collection.description: The Robert F. Kennedy Speech Collection includes audio and video recordings, photographs, as well as a transcript of Robert F. Kennedy's speech delivered at Ball State University on April 4, 1968. Kennedy's speech was devoted to domestic issues and to potential international problems that might occur after Vietnam. He talked passionately about hunger and poverty in America and the rest of the world

sourceResource.title: Man haters documentary
description: Examines a 1915 production of The manhaters, a story about what happens when the president of the local women's club, the Anti-Men Society, falls in love. Includes an analysis of the film's scenes, as they relate to modern-day Muncie, and a brief examination of the lives of some members of the cast.
Includes a full showing, with added music, of the original 1915 silent motion picture The manhaters, produced by the McHenry Film Co.
The original film sequences have been slowed to compensate for the quick pace of the original production.
Production supervisor, Alan Gordon.
Photography, Tim Underhill.
Music adaptation & performance, Kevin Purrone.
Consultant for local history, Bill Spurgeon.
Initial research, Bill Barnett.
Music research, Nyal Williams.
rights: Copyright 2007, Ball State University. All rights reserved.

To order a reproduction of the archival file, inquire about permissions, or for information about prices, contact Archives and Special Collections, Ball State University Libraries at (765) 285-5078 or send an e-mail to libarchives@bsu.edu.

collection.description: The Man Haters Film Collection includes a rare 35mm silent movie filmed in Muncie, Indiana in 1915. The film was produced by Basil McHenry, a traveling film producer from Akron, Ohio. He financed the film with sponsorship by Muncie’s Majestic Theater and The Muncie Evening Press newspaper. Readers of the Press were asked to cast their votes for the leading actresses using coupons printed in the paper. Filming began in Muncie, Indiana on November 3, 1915 and the movie opened at the Majestic Theater on November 15, 1915. Basil McHenry also produced similar films in other towns in Indiana and Ohio
collection.title: The Man Haters Film Collection

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2006-01-10
description: The Muncie Police Department found counterfeit money while raiding a home in Muncie, Indiana.

The price for first-class mail postage stamps issued by the United States Postal Service has increased by two cents. First-class mail postage stamps will cost 39 cents as of January 8, 2006. Prices for first-class mail postage stamps were last raised on June 30, 2002, from 34 cents to 37 cents.

The City of Muncie, Indiana would like to change the site where it questions children. The current location at the Youth Opportunity Center has been deemed not child-friendly. A proposed advocacy center in Muncie, Indiana might be one possible location.
The prices for Ball State University men's basketball season tickets will increase for the 2006-2007 season.
Weather.
Ball Memorial Hospital is the best hospital in Indiana for vascular care, according to rankings published by Health Grades Inc.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2005-12-14
description: Andrew Saunders, the son of Indiana State Representative for District 54 Tom Saunders, has pleaded guilty to hit-and-run driving and driving while intoxicated. Thomas Jackman of New Castle, Indiana died in the traffic accident caused by Andrew on February 4, 2005. Andrew was driving Tom's car at the time.

Medicare Part D will go into effect on January 1, 2006. Medicare Part D is a federal program to subsidize the costs of prescription drugs for Medicare beneficiaries in the United States. It was enacted as part of the Medicare Prescription Drug, Improvement, and Modernization Act of 2003 (MMA).

Henry County, Indiana has the sixth highest rate of air pollution of any county in the United States, according to a report by the United States Environmental Protection Agency. Local officials in Henry County, Indiana were surprised by the report's findings, and are asking the EPA for more details.
The Board of School Trustees of the Anderson Community School Corporation has passed proposals for two Anderson, Indiana high schools to update their sports facilities.
Local road crews are salting the roads earlier this year, in response to a recent patch of cold weather.
Weather.
The New Castle-Henry County Public Library in New Castle, Indiana has reopened after extensive renovations. The Carnegie Library building had been under construction since 2003.
The framework for Ball State University's new Communication and Media Building is now complete. BSU hopes the building will be open by the beginning of September 2007.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2005-10-05
description: The Henry County Sheriff's Department is still searching for Roscoe Fry, a prisoner who escaped from the Henry County Jail on September 28, 2005. Three other prisoners escaped with Fry, but have all since been re-captured.

A group of Boy Scouts participated in an educational reenactment at Camp Red Wing. The reenactment included actual adult jailers, policemen, lawyers, reporters, and jurors, as well Boy Scouts playing those roles. Set pieces include a mock-murder scene investigation, a mock prison and a mock trial.
The Randolph County Courthouse in Winchester, Indiana needs major structural repairs, according to a structural engineering group from Fort Wayne, Indiana.
A resident of New Castle, Indiana died after crashing his car during a high speed chase in Jay County, Indiana on October 2, 2005. His car had recently been linked to the scene of a burglary.

The Alexandria Police Department has begun using SCAN, a national alert service. SCAN allows local police and fire departments, public safety agencies, schools and hospitals to send emergency alerts and critical safety information to the PCs, mobile phones and PDAs of neighborhood residents who may be at risk. SCAN is provided to both public safety agencies and citizens completely free of charge through corporate sponsorships.

Students in Lapel, Indiana participated in a ground-breaking ceremony for the new Lapel High School. The new building will replace an older building of the same name, which is too small for the current number of students in the area.
Weather.
[DAMAGED FILE].

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2005-03-18
description: The Grant County Sheriff's Department arrested a woman who allegedly murdered her ex-husband. The woman claims that the man's death was an accident.

Two thieves stole a receptacle containing charitable contributions from inside a gas station in Muncie, Indiana. The money therein was intended for a bone marrow transplant for a child with a genetic disorder.
There is no consistency in security procedures among courts in east-central Indiana, according to a survey conducted by Newslink Indiana.
Two 911 dispatchers discuss their jobs.

Nearly 33,000 Indiana residents have been approved by Rx for Indiana, a state-sponsored program that helps low-income, uninsured Indiana residents get access to patient assistance programs and free or reduced-price prescription medicines.
Weather.

The 1954-1955 Crispus Attucks High School boys' basketball team (31-1) was collectively inducted into The Indiana Basketball Hall of Fame. The Flying Tigers' 1955 state basketball championship marked the first time an African American school won an open state tournament anywhere in the nation. CAHS also won the state title in 1955-1956 (31-0), with senior Oscar Robertson being named Indiana Mr. Basketball for 1956.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2005-11-23
description: Hundreds of volunteers in Gas City, Indiana have began preparations for the annual community Thanksgiving dinner in Gas City, Indiana.
NewsLink Indiana shares tips with viewers on how to minimize the likelihood of becoming a victim of theft over the Thanksgiving weekend.
The Delaware County Highway Department is warning drivers to slow down when roads get slippery, particularly during the first snowfall.
Students at Ball State University's Center for Media Design helped researchers study the initial reactions of video game players to the Microsoft Xbox 360.
A new type of Christmas lights are being used to decorate downtown Muncie, Indiana in December 2005. The new lights utilize LED technology, which lasts longer and is more durable than older models.
Local businesses are preparing for Black Friday 2005, which will be on November 25, 2005. The Friday after Thanksgiving is traditionally one of the busiest shopping days of the year.
Cathy's Java to Your Door, a small business in Anderson, Indiana, delivers fresh coffee to local businesses in a van equipped with a complete brewing and serving system.
ME's Zoo in Parker City, Indiana is preparing their annual display of Christmas lights. The display of over 180,000 lights will be up from Thanksgiving 2005 through Christmas 2005.
Weather.

One building in Richmond, Indiana serves as the site of both the Richmond High School and the Richmond Art Museum. The RAM is a fine art museum with a permanent collection of American Impressionists, Taos School, the Hoosier Group, the Richmond School and other regional artists. The RAM also has a small but significant collection of local ceramic artists, including works by potters of the Arts and Craft Movement, the Overbeck Sisters and the Bethel Pike potters.
New York House is a one-man restaurant in Muncie, Indiana, serving traditional Chinese cuisine.

Two local painters are participating in an art project by the Indiana Art Museum. 64 different paintings will be made of the Wabash River, by different artists and of different parts of the River. The paintings will ultimately be displayed en masse at the IAM.

description: ArtWorks Gallery and Family Center Services of Muncie, Indiana are collaborating on the Healing Through Art project, which allows abused children to display their experiences with abuse through art.

Weather.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2005-03-09
description: A judge in Marion, Indiana forced a former pastor to turn in his keys to the Grace Missionary Baptist Church in Marion, Indiana. Rev. Ed McDowell Jr. was officially voted out of his position at the GMBC in December 2004, but he insists that the vote was invalid.
Democrats in the Indiana House of Representatives indicated that they might support a portion of the Republican-authored legislation they voted against last week.
Several counties in Indiana tested their severe-storm warning devices, in preparation for the upcoming storm season.

A new program will help low-income, uninsured Indiana residents get access to patient assistance programs where they qualify for free, or nearly free, prescription medicines. Rx for Indiana is available in English or Spanish.
Weather.
In recognition of Nutrition Awareness Month 2005, LifeStream Services Inc. sponsored a week-long program about proper nutrition for the elderly.

Tensions continue between the Conner Prairie Museum and Earlham College. Some citizens of Richmond, Indiana took out an advertisement in the Indianapolis Star newspaper urging the State of Indiana to leave Conner Prairie under the control of Earlham College.
Weather.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2005-01-24
description: The Delaware County Jail in Muncie, Indiana is seeking funds to fix defective doors, some of which periodically unlock on their own.
The government of Randolph County, Indiana is considering a proposal to build an annex to the Randolph County Courthouse in Winchester, Indiana.

A proposed budget for the State of Indiana for FY 2005-2006 submitted by Republican Mitch Daniels, Governor of Indiana, would directly effect many Indiana schools that are planning on building new facilities or renovating older facilities. The proposed budget includes new guidelines for schools' spending plans, which would delay most construction projects until winter 2005 or later. If the budget is passed, some schools would need to completely renegotiate or even cancel their planned renovations.

The City of Marion, Indiana hopes to revive its annual Easter pageant after a one-year hiatus. The 2004 Marion Easter Pageant was canceled due to the prohibitive cost of heating and plumbing the venue where the event would have been held.
The Target store in Richmond, Indiana will close permanently on January 29, 2005. About 100 jobs will be lost.
Weather.
The Muncie Indiana Transit System will receive new buses in August 2005. The new MITS buses will feature improved fuel efficiency, better signage, ergonomic seating, and a new color scheme.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2004-11-19
description: Hoosier Park, a thoroughbred and standardbred racetrack located in Anderson, Indiana, is preparing for its last racing night of the 2004 season. The races may not actually occur, however, due to jockey protests related to medical insurance and safety conditions. Hoosier Park lost its entire 12-race card on November 12, 2004 when all but a few members of its jockey colony refused to ride.
The Tyson Foods, Inc. plant in Portland, Indiana will be holding a job fair. The facility recently expanded, and is in need of additional workers.
Weather.

description: An investor from Bloomington, Indiana has announced plans to purchase the ABB Power T&D plant in Muncie, Indiana. The same investor also has other plans for Muncie, Indiana - he purchased the Hotel Roberts and the Star Plaza in May 2004, and hopes to eventually build an industrial park.
Volunteers will be able to help plant trees in Riverbend Park in Anderson, Indiana. About 700 native trees will be planted along the White River.

Interested parties are invited to tour the Anderson Police Department's new station and the City of Anderson's new court facilities. The two adjacent buildings are located at 1040 Main Street and 1034 Main Street, respectively.
Weather.

description: Democrat Evan Bayh, Senator from Indiana, and Republican Mike Pence, the U.S. Representative for Indiana's 6th congressional district, worked to delay the deportation of a woman currently living in Muncie, Indiana to Sierra Leone. The politicians hope the woman will be allowed to stay in the United States with her family.

A Muncie, Indiana man observed the brawl between the Indiana Pacers and the Detroit Pistons firsthand. The NBA game between the two teams on November 19, 2004 culminated in a fight between players and fans after a Pistons fan threw a beverage at Pacers forward Ron Artest.
Weather.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2005-02-15
description: Police in Redkey, Indiana have released surveillance video of an attempted abduction in a convenience store in Redkey, Indiana. The alleged abductor, Wayne C. Melton, has since checked into Ball Memorial Hospital in Muncie, Indiana for treatment of unspecified mental health problems.
Meals on Wheels of Muncie, Inc. will soon undergo a computer upgrade. MWM hopes that the upgrade will increase the efficiency of both their office work and field operations.

The Minnetrista Cultural Center in Muncie, Indiana is celebrating the premier of a documentary film about Catalyst, a large dichroic glass, stainless steel and limestone sculpture on the MCC's grounds. The film was produced by students at Ball State University.

The Delaware County Emergency Management Agency and Ball State University are collaborating to encourage safe behavior during severe weather. The two organizations are co-presenting free workshops on storm-spotting, understanding storm systems, and how to notify authorities about approaching severe weather conditions.
Blackford County United Way Inc. raised $93,000 dollars in 2004, surpassing its original goal by $8,000.
The City of Portland's Streets and Parks Department explains how federal grants have aided its cleanup efforts after the ice storm in January 2005.
Weather.
This Old Barn Bed & Breakfast offers guests comfortable surroundings, made-from-scratch meals, and a quiet getaway from city life in Upland, Indiana.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2006-03-01
description: Ash Wednesday was on March 1, 2006. Ash Wednesday is a moveable feast celebrated by many Christian denominations, marking the first day of Lent.

A bill in the Indiana General Assembly seeks to abolish the dog tax, a law that requires dog owners in Indiana to register and pay taxes on their pet. Many dogs owners in Indiana are not aware of the dog tax, which is lightly enforced.
The Muncie Symphony Orchestra hosted a concert for students of local schools. The concert was space-themed, and featured a 15-year-old double bassist.
The Indiana General Assembly approved a bill allowing television companies and telephone companies to raise their rates for basic local service.
Some medical experts believe that American physicians might not distribute avian influenza vaccines in an ethical manner, were an avian influenza pandemic to hit the United States.
Weather.
A teenage diver from Elwood, Indiana hopes to compete in the the Games of the XXIX Olympiad (a.k.a. the 2008 Summer Olympics) in Beijing, China. Mary Beth Dunnichay is 13-years-old.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2005-11-17
description: The 909 Grille in Muncie, Indiana had a smoke-free day on November 17, 2005. The restaurant was participating in the 30th annual Great American Smokeout, sponsored nationally by the American Cancer Society and locally by the Tobacco-Free Coalition of Delaware County, Indiana.

Riverside United Methodist Church of Muncie, Indiana has teamed up with Covenant Partners Ministry of Muncie, Indiana to provide a traditional Thanksgiving meal to indigent residents of Muncie, Indiana.
The unemployment rate in Jay County, Indiana is at an all-time low. The success of various manufacturing companies in Jay County, Indiana has helped the County achieve its record employment.
Muncie Community Schools is experiencing a shortage of qualified, willing substitute teachers.

A new report by the Indiana Youth Institute includes some surprising information about schoolchildren in Indiana. The Kids Count in Indiana 2005 Data Book is one of 50 similar publications in the national Kids Count network, which is supported by the Annie E. Casey Foundation of Baltimore, Maryland.
Weather.

The fourth installment in the Harry Potter film series will open in Muncie, Indiana during the first minutes of Friday, November 18, 2005. Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire is based on the book of the same name by J. K. Rowling, originally published on July 8, 2000.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2005-11-03
description: The Muncie Police Department and the Delaware County Bomb Squad were called to the home of a deceased former NASA employee near Muncie, Indiana. The deceased man's family had discovered canisters in his basement with potentially explosive chemicals inside.
Gas prices dropped in October 2005, but are expected to rise throughout the winter of 2005.
Five different fire departments were needed to extinguish a large brush fire near Marion, Indiana on November 3, 2005.
A group of Ball State University students and a group of Australian sixth graders designed a lunar rover model entirely via web conference. The model was made from food and toothpicks.
Weather.
The Asherwood Environmental Science Center is undergoing an extensive renovation and expansion. The project is expected to cost the Marion Community Schools over $1 million dollars.
The Burris Laboratory School's high school girls' volleyball team will play for their ninth consecutive Indiana High School Athletic Association 2A state championship on November 5, 2005.

originalRecord.title: Newslink Indiana video 2004-12-20
originalRecord.coverage: Muncie; Delaware County; Indiana; United States; North and Central America;
description: Three Union City High School seniors will travel to Washington, D.C. to attend the second presidential inauguration of George W. Bush on January 20, 2005. They plan to document their trip and edit the results into a film, which will be broadcast on UCHS's school television station, KTV.
Two members of the The Board of Commissioners of Delaware County, Indiana are retiring. James St. Meyer and Jack Stonebraker both had long careers in public service.
Weather.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2004-12-31
description: Shafer Tower, a 150-foot-tall bell tower on the campus of Ball State University, was named one of the top five locations to ring in 2005, according to Verdin Company, a manufacturer of cast bells.

Allegre, a student-run restaurant at Ball State University, offers a new gourmet meal each week. Hospitality and food management students manage the restaurant, as well as seat guests, plan menus, and prepare and serve the food.

The CAP Asia program allows Ball State University students from multiple disciplines to travel to South Asia. The 10-week field study provides participants with a meaningful cross-section of world architecture, urbanism, and planning. Graduate and undergraduate students focus on collaborative design and planning projects in South Asian cities, typically hand in hand with local schools, professionals, and educators.
Weather.

The Beyond I CAN program will soon celebrate its 10th anniversary. Beyond I CAN is dedicated to enriching the lives of people with disabilities through the experience of running their own businesses. The Beyond I Can Gallery & Gift Shop is located in Muncie, Indiana.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2004-12-29
description: A Madison County, Indiana man has died after his truck slid into an ice-covered creek. He was unconscious and already suffering from hypothermia when paramedics removed him from his fully submerged vehicle.
The Blackford County Courthouse in Hartford City, Indiana had to be evacuated after a gas leak was discovered. The leak was caused by ice falling on a gas meter.

The Anderson Police Department arrested a man who allegedly stole nearly $5,500 from Mofab Inc., a metals warehouse and fabrication center in Anderson, Indiana. The prisoner is alleged to have changed the receipts of cash-paying customers at Mofab while he was formerly employed there.
SBC Communications released its annual list of the most frequently-reported telecommunications scams and threats in 2004. SBC also offered advice on how to avoid becoming the victim of such frauds.
Many of the vendors at Webb's Antique Mall of Centerville, Indiana are offering after-Christmas sales. Webb's is one of the largest antique malls in the United States.
Weather.
The Indiana Lions Eyeglass Recycling Center in Upland, Indiana cleans, repackages, and redistributes old eyeglasses to 76 countries worldwide.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2004-12-14
description: Comcast Corporation will premiere a new cable package on January 5, 2005. Limited Basic Cable will include a range of basic channels including local broadcast stations (ABC, CBS, NBC, FOX, PBS, etc.), and exclusive local government and education channels. It will be Comcast's smallest and most inexpensive cable package thusfar.

The Marion Street Department is unable to afford road salt for use on Marion, Indiana's streets this winter, due to budgetary constraints. The MSD will use beet juice instead, for the second consecutive year.
Weather.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2005-01-19
description: A small plane crashed at the Delaware County Airport due to bad weather. No one was injured.

Republican Kevin S. Smith, Mayor of Anderson, Indiana, has hired a consultant to help revitalize Anderson's economy. The consultant will identify and recruit new businesses and business opportunities for the city.

A resident of Anderson, Indiana has filed a class-action lawsuit against the Advanced Magnesium Alloys Corporation plant in Anderson, Indiana. The resident is seeking damages from AMACOR after a fire at their plant forced thousands of Anderson, Indiana residents to evacuate their homes.

The Nettle Creek Classroom Teachers Association has filed a complaint against the Nettle Creek School Corporation on behalf of teacher Sharon Lucero, citing unfair labor practices. Lucero was reassigned from teaching English 12 and Honors/AP English in 2003-2004 to teaching English 7 in 2004-2005, which she considers reprimanding without just cause. Lucero had previously filed discrimination charges with the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission, alleging gender discrimination, national origin discrimination, retaliation, and hostile work environment.
Local branches of the American Red Cross discuss the effects of the recent ice storm on their annual budget.
The government of Blackford County, Indiana has received money to help upgrade its voting equipment as a result of the Help Indiana Vote Act.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2005-02-07
description: A local resident crashed his car into a parked car and then a house. No one was seriously injured.

Republican Dan Canan, Mayor of Muncie, Indiana, wants to levy an additional tax on students at Ball State University and Ivy Tech Community College. Mayor Canan has proposed a $25 per-semester tuition tax for students of non-profit universities in the State of Indiana.

A Florida couple accused of torturing their children originally met in Muncie, Indiana while attending Ball State University. John Dollar and Linda Dollar were apprehended in Utah after fleeing their home in Florida
A deputy in the Wayne County Sheriff' Department has been arrested for drunk driving.
The Packaging and Shipping Store in Richmond, Indiana caught fire. The inside of the store was damaged, but no one was hurt..

Developers would like to build a Concentrated Animal Feeding Operation in Randolph County, Indiana, which would house over 16,000 head of cattle under one roof. Some residents worry that manure runoff from the CAFO could cause water pollution. The would-be operator of the CAFO plans on building a 21 million-gallon lagoon, which he claims would prevent runoff altogether.

New InterUrban, a rural public transportation service based in Yorktown, Indiana, is expanding its scope. NIU will now offer door-to-door service in Blackford County, Delaware County, Jay County and Randolph County, Indiana. NIU is open to people of all ages, though most of its passengers are elderly, ill or infirm..
Weather.

description: Local bus drivers have been adversely effected by rising gas prices.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2005-02-11
description: The Youth Opportunity Center in Muncie, Indiana is under investigation after one of its minor residents accused an adult resident of molesting him. A 5-year-old boy told his mother and staff members that he was molested by his 18-year-old male roommate. State policies forbid children with age discrepancies that wide from rooming together.

The Muncie Disaster Recovery Center in Muncie, Indiana will switch its emphasis from working with the Federal Emergency Management Agency to working with the Small Business Administration. Some FEMA representatives will remain at the Center for the immediate future, though.
Local Boy Scouts spent a day shadowing city officials to learn about how city government works.

Would-be college students can receive free assistance filling out their financial aid forms, courtesy of a new program sponsored by the State of Indiana. Several local institutions are participating in the program, including Anderson University of Anderson, Indiana and Ball State University of Muncie, Indiana.

A collection of creamers at Taylor University in Upland, Indiana will be featured on the Food Network's Unwrapped television program. The Rice Cow Creamer Collection consists of over 250 cow-shaped cream receptacles, including sterling silver and antiques pieces.
Weather.
Lowery's Candies of Muncie, Indiana explains how they are preparing for Valentine's Day 2005. Traditionally, February 14 is their busiest day of the year.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2004-12-01
description: A group of Ukrainian students at Ball State University are upset about the recently completed Ukrainian presidential election of 2004, which is widely believed to have been rigged in favor of Prime Minister Viktor Yanukovych. The aggrieved students are collecting donations to send to protesters in the Ukraine, who believe that opposition candidate Viktor Yushchenko was the rightful winner.
Republican Mike Pence, U.S. Representative for Indiana's 6th congressional district, visited Muncie, Indiana to speak about reforms made in the U.S. after the September 11 attacks.
Weather.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2006-02-22
description: The government of Delaware County, Indiana will not proactively seek out violators of its new law banning smoking in public places. Authorities will rely on tips and complaints from citizens, which the authorities will investigate further.
A small airplane crashed in Delaware County, Indiana. Investigators believe that engine failure caused the crash.

William Gruppe III and Michael Gruppe pleaded guilty to multiple felony charges each, stemming from the tire fire that destroyed their Cr3 tire recycling business in Muncie, Indiana on August 1, 2003. They have been ordered to pay a fine and to pay to clean up the area.

Professor George Wolfe of Ball State University is being sharply criticized by David Horowitz, a conservative author and policy advocate. Horowitz selected Professor Wolfe for inclusion in his recently published book The Professors, The 101 Most Dangerous Academics in America. Professor Wolfe is currently serving as the Director of Peace Studies in BSU's Center for Peace and Conflict Studies.
Weather.
Tony Dungy, Head Coach of the Indianapolis Colts, visited Anderson, Indiana to commemorate the 100th anniversary of a local church.
Eighth-graders at Delta Middle School in Muncie, Indiana competed against one another in a design contest. The students sought to design a chair from junk, with as many uses as possible.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2006-02-16
description: Three people were taken to Ball Memorial Hospital after an accident in Delaware County, Indiana.
The White River is slowly eroding the riverbanks near the Grandview Golf Course in Anderson, Indiana. The GGC plans to take preliminary actions to prevent the erosion from damaging the golf course.
Pleasant View Elementary School in Yorktown, Indiana has completed its new playground. The playground was paid for by a multi-year fundraising effort.
Pratt Industries Inc. announced that they will close their factory in Marion, Indiana. PII makes 100% recycled corrugated boxes and packaging.
Weather.

A law firm in Muncie, Indiana is celebrating its 100th anniversary. The law firm has decided to commemorate the occasion by paying one year's worth of rent for the Muncie Children's Museum in Muncie, Indiana.
Students of Grissom Elementary School in Muncie, Indiana put on a play to raise money for the Wayside Mission in Muncie, Indiana.

The parents of local soldiers who were killed in action reflect upon their children's lives.

A member of the Indiana House of Representative has proposed a new law that would require movie theaters to display the time that their movies actually begin.

Weather.

Police in Redkey, Indiana have arrested a man who allegedly attempted to abduct a convenience store employee in Redkey, Indiana. The alleged abductor, Wayne C. Melton, later checked into Ball Memorial Hospital in Muncie, Indiana for treatment of unspecified mental health problems.
Family Forever Ministries Inc. of Anderson, Indiana hopes to purchase and renovate Killbuck Park in Anderson, Indiana. FFMI is currently in the fundraising stage.

Schools under the jurisdiction of The Delaware Community School Corporation, Cowan Community Schools and the Jay School Corporation all performed well on the Indiana Statewide Testing for Educational Progress standardized tests, exceeding the average scores.
Weather.
Cell phone advertising might be the wave of the future, according to a study by the Ball State University Department of Journalism.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2004-09-08
description: The Ontario Corporation and Sherry Labs will locate their new headquarters in storefronts formerly occupied by the Daleville Outlet Mall in Daleville, Indiana. Only 9 stores of the original 65 stores in the outlet mall still remain.

The Environmental Protection Agency is stepping in to clean up a local hazardous waste site, at an estimated cost of $50,000 dollars. The owner of the site, Rich Reese, had begun clean-up efforts but has since run out of money. Reese is facing various charges.
Weather.

Health officials in Delaware County, Indiana report that some local residents who believe that they are suffering from the flu might actually have the Norovirus, an RNA virus that causes approximately 90% of epidemic non-bacterial outbreaks of gastroenteritis.

The High Street Bridge in Muncie, Indiana will close for approximately one year for repairs, beginning on February 2, 2005. The High Street Bridge is one of three bridges connecting North and South Muncie, Indiana.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2005-01-10
description: Republican Mitch Daniels, Governor of Indiana, was inaugurated on January 10, 2005 in Indianapolis, Indiana. Thousands of people gathered at the Pepsi Coliseum on the Indiana State Fairgrounds to watch the swearing-in ceremony.
Republican Mike Pence, the U.S. Representative for Indiana's 6th congressional district, visited victims of the ice storm in Muncie, Indiana.

The power is still out in Winchester County, Indiana and Randolph County, Indiana. Government officials and utility companies are working to both restore electricity and to improve the power infrastructure.
Weather.
Local businesses discuss the negative effect of the ice storm on their bottom line. Many local businesses are still without power.
Indiana Michigan Power explains some of the problems associated with restoring power to an entire city. Many local residents are still without electricity.
Ball State University has power, and has returned to its normal schedule. Many local schools remain without electricity, though, like Cowan Elementary School.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2006-01-23
description: Investigators are attempting to discover the cause of a fire that destroyed a home in Dunkirk, Indiana.
Ball State University's new athletic director, Tom Collins, is mid-way through his first month on the job.

A new program is calling for local fathers to volunteer at Wilson Middle School in Muncie, Indiana. Fathers who participate in the Security Dad program are present at WMS during the school day to help with various duties.

The James Dean Gallery in Gas City, Indiana will reopen after receiving an influx of last-minute donations. The Gallery closed in December 2005 due to money problems, 19 months after moving to Gas City, Indiana from its long-time home in Fairmount, Indiana. The gallery contains the private collection of archivist David Loehr, which is the world's largest collection of James Dean collectibles and memorabilia.
Weather.
A new machine that brews green tea is becoming increasingly popular. Proponents of green tea consumption claim numerous health benefits, including cardiovascular and weight control applications.
Veterinarians warn pet owners about chemicals commonly used during wintertime that can be harmful to their pets.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2006-01-06
description: Investigators in Muncie, Indiana do not believe that the fire that killed two residents on January 5, 2006 was an act of arson.

A strip club in Muncie, Indiana has been shut down by the Muncie-Delaware County Drug Task Force. A raid on The Red Slipper led to the arrest of 9 people, both patrons and employees, for charges ranging from public intoxication to possession of controlled substances. The MDCDTF also found numerous health and building code violations, which may prevent the club from reopening.

Construction continues on the Losantville-Mt. Pleasant expansion of the Cardinal Greenway. The current terminus of the Cardinal Greenway is County Road 532 East in Delaware County, Indiana. The eventual terminus of the Cardinal Greenway will be 7 miles away in Losantville, Indiana.
Jo Ann M. Gora, President of Ball State University, is in Washington, D.C. this week for a summit on international education.
Weather.

Chemical compound testing conducted by the Indiana Department of Environmental Management in New Castle, Indiana was inconclusive. IDEM had hoped to discover the source and the cause of a lingering foul odor which has been plaguing New Castle, Indiana for years.
A new law in Winchester, Indiana requires pet owners to register their animals. The registration fees collected will be allocated to the Randolph County Animal Shelter in Winchester, Indiana.

A high school choir teacher in Anderson, Indiana has been accused of acting inappropriately with two students. Charges may not be filed, though, due to lack of evidence.
Weather.

A resident of Albany, Indiana had to be cut out of his car after a traffic accident. He had sideswiped a semi-trailer truck on State Road 67.
The Muncie Community Schools' Board of School Trustees approved more than $19 million dollars in renovations for Muncie Southside High School in Muncie, Indiana.
A high school choir teacher in Anderson, Indiana has been accused of acting inappropriately with two students. Charges may not be filed, though, due to lack of evidence.
Weather.
Angel Wish will provide gifts and necessities to isolated and impoverished elderly people in east-central Indiana during the Christmas season.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2005-11-01
description: The Delaware County Health Department administered influenza vaccine at the Daleville Town Hall in Daleville, Indiana. Even though the DCHD did not get their full order of influenza vaccine for 2005, there have been enough flu shots to treat all interested Delaware County, Indiana residents thusfar.

ATA Airlines Inc. has announced that it will cease providing service to and from its home city of Indianapolis, Indiana on January 10, 2006. ATA filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection on October 26, 2004, and has been scaling back operations ever since.

A new educational campaign strives to educate retailers about how to spot consumers who may be purchasing equipment for methamphetamine labs. Meth Watch hopes to curb the sudden rise in the number of methamphetamine labs in east-central Indiana.
The Muncie Sanitation Department plans to continue leaf pickup as normal in the fall of 2005.
Weather.
The Morrisson-Reeves Library in Richmond, Indiana began The Kick It Up reading challenge on November 1, 2005. The program encourages childhood literacy.

The City of Anderson, Indiana is seeking grant money to fund a program targeting brownfield sites. Brownfield sites are abandoned or underused industrial and commercial facilities available for re-use, in which expansion or redevelopment may be complicated by real or perceived environmental contaminations.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2005-12-12
description: Hundreds of residents of Muncie, Indiana were left without electricity for three hours after an automobile struck a utility pole on the edge of Muncie, Indiana.
Ball State University received a $20 million dollar contribution from the Eli Lilly Company. The gift will be used to enhance digital media resources at BSU.
The government of Madison County, Indiana has approved a residential property tax cut that could save some homeowners in Madison County, Indiana up to $200.

The Town of Yorktown, Indiana is reassessing their regulations pertaining to zoning, land use and economic development. The Town of Yorktown, Indiana is the fastest-growing municipality in Delaware County, Indiana.
The Xbox 360 video game console has been sold out of every local store since its release on November 22, 2005.
Weather.
Local Christmas tree vendors are offering everything from real trees to contemporary upside-down artificial trees.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2005-10-28
description: The Indiana Bureau of Motor Vehicles will be open for extended hours on November 8, 2005 to accommodate citizens before Election Day (November 9, 2005). A new law requires all would-be Indiana voters to present a state-issued photo ID before voting.
Ball Memorial Hospital held its third annual Health Center, an open house which offers discounted prices on some health, vision and hearing services.
The Institute for Innovation selected Sunnyside Elementary School in New Castle, Indiana as one of six exemplary schools. The IFI honored SES for its utilization of technology in the classroom.
NewsLink Indiana shares tips on how to make one's Halloween decorating more pet-friendly.
Weather.
A resident of Anderson, Indiana is currently ranked as the top 14-year-old judo fighter in the country. She will be participating in an international competition in Costa Rica soon.

Fourth-graders from St. Lawrence Elementary School in Muncie, Indiana took a field trip to the Indiana History Train to observe an exhibit on Abraham Lincoln. The Indiana History Train is a traveling museum with rotating exhibits, jointly sponsored by the The Indiana Historical Society and The Indiana Rail Road Company.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2005-11-22
description: The owners of some restaurants and bars in Muncie, Indiana are against a proposed smoking ban in Muncie, Indiana. A few business owners even wonder if such a ban would force them to shut down completely.

The Hoosier Heartland Red Cross is anticipating a blood shortage in east-central Indiana. The HHRC has planned several blood-related events during the holiday season, but fears they may not yield enough blood.
The General Motors Company has confirmed that it will not be closing any of its plant location in Indiana. GM will be closing several plants in other parts of North America.
The New Castle-Henry County Municipal Airport in New Castle, Indiana has been vandalized. Some of the NCHCMA's runway lights were destroyed.

The Rural King Supply store in Muncie, Indiana has seen an increase in the sales of pellet-burning stoves, which use pellets made of wood and corn. Rural King believes that local consumers are searching for alternative fuel sources for heat.

The Indiana State Police have announced that extra officers will be patrolling the roads over the 2005 Thanksgiving weekend. The ISP will be looking for violations of the Indiana Seat Belt Law (IC 9-19-10).
Weather.
The Dunkirk City Public Library will be hosting another food drive. DCPL patrons may have fines waived in exchange for donating food items.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2006-02-09
description: Something is causing SAT scores for thousands of students in Indiana to list incorrectly. Some SAT scores are off by as much as 100 points.

An author from Muncie, Indiana gave a speech to students at Muncie Central High School in Muncie, Indiana. The author believed he was caucasian until his adulthood, when he discovered he was actually African-American. The author's memoir describes how his changing perspectives influenced his views on race and racial discrimination.
A resident of Muncie, Indiana has been arrested for allegedly committing sexual crimes against an underage girl via the internet.
The City of Alexandria, Indiana is encouraging its residents to clean up their properties and residences.

The Acquire the Fire Evangelical Christian youth conference will soon visit the Worthen Arena at Ball State University in Muncie, Indiana. Acquire the Fire is part of Teen Mania Ministries' Battle Cry Campaign.
Weather.
The Muncie Home Builders Association is preparing for their 10th annual Home, Garden, Patio & Remodeling Show in Muncie, Indiana.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2005-03-02
description: Many Democrats in the Indiana General Assembly chose not to attend legislative sessions, in order to protest the conduct of their Republican colleagues. The aggrieved Democrats claim that the Republicans are misusing their new-found majorities, and are being especially inflexible on certain key issues.

Republican Dan Canan, Mayor of Muncie, Indiana, announced the formation of the City-County Council for People with Disabilities. The 11-member council hopes to improve transportation, accessibility, and employment opportunities for persons with disabilities in Muncie, Indiana and Delaware County, Indiana.

The Mount Vernon Community School Corporation wants to renovate the schools under its jurisdiction, in order to better accommodate increasing class sizes. The MVCSC has proposed local tax increases to meet their goals.
NewsLink Indiana shares safety tips for trimming trees damaged by the ice storms of January 2005.
Weather.

Employees at Holland Colors Americas Inc. in Richmond, Indiana explain their role in The Gates, a site-specific work of art by Christo and Jeanne-Claude. HCA created the deep saffron color used in the 7503 nylon fabric panels placed along a 23-mile-long route in New York City's Central Park.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2006-12-05
description: The United States Post Office is encouraging customers to mail items extra early during the holiday season.
The renovation of the High Street Bridge in Muncie, Indiana is nearly complete. The multimillion-dollar project is expected to meet its original deadline for completion.

The current Sheriff of Henry County, Indiana will not seek re-election. The current Sheriff's wife will run for Sheriff in the next election. She has already received the current Sheriff's endorsement.
Freezing rain caused several traffic accidents in Muncie, Indiana on December 2, 2006.

Autonomous cruise control systems may help avoid traffic accidents. ACC systems use either a radar or laser setup to detect other vehicles, then automatically slow their vehicle when it approaches another vehicle. One's vehicle accelerates to the preset speed again when traffic allows.
Weather.
The Envision internship program at Anderson University in Anderson, Indiana helps students gain relevant experience and increase their likelihood of future employment.
Local business, like Adair's Corner Market in Pennville, Indiana, are having difficulty competing with chain superstores, like Wal-Mart.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2005-12-02
description: Authorities in New Castle, Indiana are investigating the deaths of four kittens in a garage fire in New Castle, Indiana.
Authorities in Muncie, Indiana are investigating whether a house fire that destroyed a porch in Muncie, Indiana was an act of arson.
The Muncie Hope House in Muncie, Indiana will be able to remain open, thanks to a wave of last-minute donations. MHH works with recovering drug and alcohol addicts.

The Muncie Public Library's John F. Kennedy Library branch may be moving from its current location on McGalliard Road to a new location on North Wheeling Avenue. MPL has received an offer to purchase the Kennedy Library's current location from a real estate company. MPL has been planning to renovate the Kennedy Library for years.
Weather.

A McDonald's restaurant has re-opened in Newcastle, Indiana after undergoing a high-tech redesign. The restaurant now includes wireless internet access, updated computer systems, a fireplace, and new playground equipment.
Charlie's Coffee Shop in Richmond, Indiana has erected a toy train display to celebrate the 2005 holiday season. The trains are an annual tradition at Charlie's Coffee Shop.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2006-02-07
description: School officials at Muncie Central High School in Muncie, Indiana are revising their procedures for dealing with bomb threats.
The Economic Development Corporation of Wayne County, Indiana is concentrating on both attracting and retaining young professionals.
The Muncie Common Council unanimously approved a new curfew law for minors in Muncie, Indiana. The MCC hopes the curfew will lower crime rates in Muncie, Indiana.
The Indiana National Guard is experiencing increased enlistment rates.
Sirens will announce all severe weather events in Marion, Indiana beginning on March 1, 2006. Sirens are currently used only to announce tornados in Marion, Indiana.
Weather.
Richard's Restaurant in Hartford City, Indiana is celebrating its twenty-fifth anniversary.

Rob Hansen attributes the delay to a mix-up between his lawyers and the Alcohol and Tobacco Commission of Indiana.
Weather.

originalRecord.coverage: Muncie; Delaware County; Indiana; United States; North and Central America;
description: The mayor of Richmond, Indiana vetoed a request to rezone the Hayes Arboretum to a commercial zone. The Hayes Arboretum is currently zoned as a greenspace preservation area. Those in favor of rezoning say that they will take their case to court.

Weather.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2006-02-27
description: A man is in critical condition after a one-vehicle traffic accident on I-69 South on February 27, 2006.
Several supervisors and a worker for Ball State University Catering face a federal complaint alleging racial harassment.
Three inmates briefly escaped from the Madison County Jail in Anderson, Indiana. All were apprehended several hours later.
A group of local churches want to ban Muncie Gras, a fundraiser held in Muncie, Indiana to benefit local charities. Muncie Gras 2006 was held on February 24, 2006.
The Marion Police Department are holding a mother in custody for allegedly leaving her 8-year-old child home alone for an extended period of time.
A new method for filling potholes is being used in Montpelier, Indiana. Road crews there are using a hot box to keep the asphalt warm while it is being transported.

A deaf inmate's criminal trial will continue with the use of a transcriber. The inmate had requested that the court halt the trial, then pay for and perform cochlear implant surgery on his behalf before resuming.
Weather.
Children at Storer Elementary School in Muncie, Indiana watched a puppet show about physical disabilities, mental disabilities, and disability awareness.

Ball State University faculty members collaborated with the Ball State University Biomechanics Laboratory to create a music educational DVD. The art of the bow makes extensive use of cutting edge motion-sensing technology and interactive screens.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2006-03-16
description: Ball Memorial Hospital of Muncie, Indiana announced plans to construct a new, five-story tall patient tower.
Republican Kevin S. Smith, Mayor of Anderson, Indiana, will be traveling to Israel. Mayor Smith hopes to secure additional foreign investment in Anderson, Indiana.
Some college students from east-central Indiana will be using their spring breaks to help victims of Hurricane Katrina.

Thousands of Indiana children were removed from their homes by the government in 2005 because of child abuse or neglect, according to a report by The National Coalition for Child Protective Reform. The NCCPR is a non-governmental organization working to change public policy concerning child abuse, foster care and family preservation.
Weather.

The State of Indiana will officially observe Daylight Saving Time beginning on April 2, 2006. Eight counties will also move from the Eastern Time Zone to the Central Time Zone - Daviess County, Dubois County, Knox County, Martin County, Perry County, Pike County, Pulaski County and Starke County. There will now be 74 counties in the Eastern Time Zone (down from 82) and 18 counties in the Central Time Zone (up from 10).

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2005-02-03
description: The proposed annex to the Randolph County Courthouse in Winchester, Indiana will be debated at a public meeting.

The American Dental Association's third annual Give Kids a Smile day will be on February 4, 2005. Each year on the first Friday in February, thousands of dentists and their dental team members provide free oral health care services to children from low-income families across the country.

The first confirmed cases of influenza in Delaware County, Indiana this season have been observed. In response, Ball Memorial Hospital and the Delaware County Health Department will sponsor a flu vaccination and pneumonia vaccination clinic.
The Indiana Senate has passed a bill that would raise the speed limit for interstate driving in Indiana from 65 m.p.h. to 70 m.p.h.
A large sinkhole in Richmond, Indiana is being repaired, after several delays. The repairs are estimated to take three weeks.
Weather.
Sales of HDTV sets are rising, even though local television service providers offer little high-definition programming currently.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2006-02-01
description: The Indiana State Police are required to inspect all buses used to transport pupils in the state of Indiana. Each bus is inspected to determine compliance with the safety requirements prescribed for school bus construction and equipment in the official rules and regulations of the Indiana State School Bus Committee.
Muncie Central High School in Muncie, Indiana has repaired the damaged caused by vandals on January 27, 2006. MCHS is offering a reward for information leading to the vandals' capture.

Daleville Community Schools has received a long-awaited $8.3 million grant, which it will use to renovate the Daleville Junior/Senior High School in Daleville, Indiana. Renovations at DJSHS will include improvements to the building, the parking lot, and the track, as well as an expansion of the bathrooms.

Indiana Michigan Power announced that it will spend $5.5 million dollars to upgrade its power lines in downtown Muncie, Indiana. Some power lines that are currently above-ground will also be buried, for aesthetic reasons.
The Vectren Corporation announced that the cost of natural gas will be lower than previously expected for the immediate future.
Weather.

Delta High School in Muncie, Indiana publishes a school newspaper. The Eagle's Eye is available both in print and online. Unlike some school newspapers, TEE lists students' full names in its stories, rather than removing their last names.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2005-03-15
description: Employment rates in east-central Indiana are increasing, according to a quarterly employment survey by Manpower Inc. The fastest growing areas are construction, non-durable manufacturing and services.
The Indiana State Police will be increasing their presence on I-69 near Redkey, Indiana. The ISP is responding to increasing traffic and traffic accidents between mile markers 32 and 72.
Great Kids Day Care Center in Muncie, Indiana offers free day care for children whose parents are serving active military duty.

Students at North Side Elementary School in Hartford City, Indiana were the recipients of a free fitness clinic hosted by coaches from the WNBA's Indiana Fever. NSES received the clinic for its performance in a state program encouraging fitness in children, which one hundred percent of their student body participated in.

The Muncie Central High School boys' basketball team advanced to the semifinals of the Indiana High School Athletic Association's Class 4A 2004-2005 State Tournament. Two more wins would make them state champions for their division, which includes the most populous high schools in the State of Indiana.
Weather.

Hundreds of children from Muncie Community Schools visited the 27th annual Delaware County Farm Festival at the Delaware County Fairgrounds in Muncie, Indiana. Many students took part in hands-on farm activities.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2006-03-03
description: A jury in Blackford County, Indiana has found a local woman guilty of a murder.

Elizabeth Ann Holloway spoke to students at Ball State University about the importance of safety while vacationing. Ms. Holloway's daughter, Natalee Holloway, disappeared on May 30, 2005 during a high school graduation trip to Aruba.
The Town Council for the City of Pendleton, Indiana has approved the purchase of the Pendleton Banking Building in Pendleton, Indiana. The PBB will be used to house the new Pendleton Town Hall.
Voters in Muncie, Indiana will see several changes in voting procedures in May 2007, including new electronic voting machines and increased accessibility for handicapped persons.

Taylor University in Anderson, Indiana will fund a planned Global Engagement Centre with a $1.5 million gift from a 1984 alumna. The Cindy L. Spencer Centre for Global Engagement will be named for its primary benefactor - Cindy L. Spencer Marrelli, a businesswoman in Raleigh, North Carolina. The Spencer Centre will be the first of 10 planned Global Engagement Centres worldwide, and will enable Taylor University to pursue course offerings and outreach on a global scale.
Weather.

A bill in the Indiana General Assembly would make it more difficult for Indiana students to drop out of school. The Indiana Department of Education says that graduation rates are down more than 1% since the 2001-2002 school year. The DOE's goal is for 90% of Indiana high school students to graduate in 4 years or less.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2005-10-04
description: A series of fires and explosions erupted at the former Thomson SA plant in Marion, Indiana after a live wire was accidentally severed. Several men were injured, one of whom is in critical condition.

Residents living near the former Thomson SA plant in Marion, Indiana were forced to evacuate their homes. A series of fires and explosions erupted at the building, releasing toxic fumes. Emergency workers and charitable organizations assisted the displaced citizens, including the Red Cross and the Salvation Army.
The City of New Castle, Indiana is considering raising the cost of its water and sewage utilities. One restaurant is bracing for the change by washing its dishes by hand.
Weather.

originalRecord.title: Newslink Indiana video 2005-10-04
originalRecord.coverage: Muncie; Delaware County; Indiana; United States; North and Central America;
description: A series of fires and explosions erupted at the former Thomson SA plant in Marion, Indiana after a live wire was accidentally severed. Several men were injured, one of whom is in critical condition.

Residents living near the former Thomson SA plant in Marion, Indiana were forced to evacuate their homes. A series of fires and explosions erupted at the building, releasing toxic fumes. Emergency workers and charitable organizations assisted the displaced citizens, including the Red Cross and the Salvation Army.
The City of New Castle, Indiana is considering raising the cost of its water and sewage utilities. One restaurant is bracing for the change by washing its dishes by hand.
Weather.
A resident and employee of the Muncie Mission in Muncie, Indiana discusses his recovery from alcoholism.
[DAMAGED FILE].

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2006-03-22
description: Funeral services were held for a soldier from Grant County, Indiana. Family members, friends, community members and the Patriot Guard Riders motorcycle club were all in attendance. The soldier was killed while serving in the War in Afghanistan.
A rumored protest at the funeral services for a soldier from Grant County, Indiana did not occur.
A man was beaten to death in his home in Muncie, Indiana.

Ball State University is planning major changes to its campus recreational facilities. BSU plans to build a new fitness center, remodel Irving Gymnasium, and make several additions to other existing facilities.
A local Holocaust survivor told his story to students in Delaware County, Indiana. He urged the students to fight for equality.
SLM Corporation plans to open an office in Muncie, Indiana. The new Sallie Mae location is expected to both create 700 new jobs and stimulate other businesses in the area.
Weather.

The Jay County High School boys' basketball team won its state tournament semifinal game on a last-second shot. JCHS advanced to the Indiana High School Athletic Association's Class 3A 2005-2006 State Finals, where they will face New Castle Chrysler High School of New Castle, Indiana. New Castle High School, the predecessor of NCCHS, won the IHSAA's single division tournament in 1932.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2006-03-17
description: Tony Dungy, Head Coach of the Indianapolis Colts, gave a religious speech at Ball State University's Emens Auditorium.

St. Patrick's Day falls on a Friday this year - March 17, 2006. Local Catholic bishops have advised their congregations that they are permitted to eat meat on St. Patrick's Day, especially if they are observing family or ethnic traditions by doing so. In the Roman Catholic Church it is traditional to abstain from meat from mammals and fowl on every Friday for the duration of Lent, although dairy products are still permitted.
High schools in Muncie, Indiana have adopted a new system to combat bullying. A Bully Box will be posted in each school, in which students can leave reports about bullies.
The Indiana Department of Homeland Security is urging residents of Indiana to prepare both an evacuation plan and a disaster kit in the event of an emergency.
Weather.

The Old Winchester Graveyard Restoration Committee continues its efforts to restore the The Old Winchester Graveyard in Winchester, Indiana. The OWGRC hopes to repair, re-erect and clean over 100 monuments that have been neglected for decades. The OWG restoration is a project of the Randolph County, Indiana Historical Society.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2006-01-25
description: A $6.2 million dollar proposal by the Randolph Eastern School Corporation hopes to yield improvements in science and technology resources, improve library capabilities, and increase classroom space.
A company will be drilling for oil in Alexandria, Indiana. Local residents hope that the drilling will create new jobs and business opportunities.
Many college students lack several basic skills necessary to succeed in life, according to a new national study. The average college student is especially deficient in mathematics and map-reading.
A local man faces four months in jail for smuggling a rare type of flowering orchid overseas.
Some meteorologists are concerned about the possible impact of high winds in the area.
Weather.

Many students at Taylor University in Upland, Indiana love ice cream - but only one of them has tried all 100 varieties of ice cream shakes AND all 100 varieties of ice cream sundaes at Ivanhoe's. The Ivanhoe Drive In in Upland, Indiana is a restaurant best known for its desserts and sandwiches.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2006-02-09
description: Marsh Supermarkets announced that they will be closing nine area grocery and convenience stores due to financial problems. Marsh will also be eliminating four executive positions.

Republican Dan Canan, Mayor of Muncie, hopes to expand Japanese investment in Muncie, Indiana. Increasing foreign capital is one goal of Vision 2006, the fourth economic-development initiative in Delaware County, Indiana since 1984.
Repairs to Hibbert Middle School in Richmond, Indiana have been completed. The roof over HMS' indoor swimming pool collapsed on December 27, 2004 under the weight of several inches of snow.

A resident of Hartford City, Indiana has been accused of inadvertently killing a baby. He was allegedly driving while intoxicated. His trial begins on April 10, 2006.

A senior at Ball State University has created an online interactive game called McKinley Road Rage. Therein, the player controls a driver attempting to navigate McKinley Avenue in Muncie, Indiana. The goal is to deliver a BSU student safely to their class.

Indiana ranks 35th out of the 50 states in public arts funding. Some local organizations are trying to find ways to increase public arts funding.

First graders who attended full-day kindergarten have better scores in multiple subjects than first graders who attended half-day kindergarten, according to statistics released by Marion Community Schools in January 2006.

NewsLink Indiana cautions its viewers about the dangers of phishing. Phising is the criminally fraudulent process of attempting to acquire sensitive information such as usernames, passwords and credit card details by masquerading as a trustworthy entity in an electronic communication. Emails sent by criminals purporting to be from online auction sites are a common form of phishing.
An agricultural summit was held at Ball State University on December 7, 2005. The summit focused on advancements in agriculture made in Indiana.

Indiana Wesleyan University is preparing to close off a busy street near their Marion, Indiana campus. Automobile traffic will be restricted on the street, in hopes of making the campus safer for pedestrians.
Meijer stores around Indiana are selling prepackaged bags of food, designed to be purchased and then directly donated to local food pantries.
Weather.
The Ball State University Department of Theatre and Dance will perform the Romantic comic ballet Coppelia. Coppelia will be the first first-length ballet staged by BSU students in over 25 years.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2005-02-14
description: Thousands of homes and businesses in Muncie, Indiana briefly lost power on the afternoon of February 14, 2005. Indiana Michigan Power had to temporarily shut down power along McGalliard Road in Muncie, Indiana to fix a malfunctioning transformer.

The New Castle Police Department has issued additional subpoenas related to a hit-and-run traffic accident that killed Thomas Jackman of New Castle, Indiana on February 4, 2005. Andrew Saunders, the son of Indiana State Representative for District 54 Tom Saunders, is listed as a person of interest.
A Marion, Indiana man has been sentenced to three years in jail. Roger Randolph was involved in a shooting at a bar in Madison County, Indiana in August 2004.

The first phase of renovations to the New Castle-Henry County Public Library is now complete. The NCHCPL now includes a larger children's reading room, a 180-seat auditorium, and an Indiana history study room.

The Anderson Community School Corporation may be forced to lay off 50+ teachers, eliminate certain classes and/or increase classroom sizes. Those initiatives would address planned cuts in state funding for public K-12 education, which ACSC estimates would cost them millions of dollars.
A local dog appears to have been attacked by a coyote. The possibility of coyote attacks has some local residents fearful for the safety of their own pets.
Weather.
Landmark Village Florist of Muncie, Indiana explains what a typical Valentine's Day means for their business.

NewsLink staff can be found covering Grant, Blackford, Jay, Randolph, Wayne, Henry, Madison and Delaware counties.
collection.title: Newslink Indiana Videos

originalRecord.title: Newslink Indiana video 2004-06-22
originalRecord.coverage: Muncie; Delaware County; Indiana; United States; North and Central America;
description: The Muncie Police Department says that a Ball State University student is on suicide watch. The student is suspected of setting fire to the home of his ex-girlfriend's new boyfriend while the couple slept inside.

The Maxwell Centennial Celebration Tour 2004 will be held in New Castle, Indiana from June 21, 2004 through June 24, 2004. The Tour celebrates the 100th anniversary of the founding of the Maxwell-Briscoe Company, an early automobile manufacturer.
Weather.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2006-01-18
description: An Anderson Police Department officer injured a local dog. The officer shot the dog in self-defense, after it approached him aggressively.

The Anderson Police Department arrested two residents of Anderson, Indiana for their roles in an alleged statutory rape. A 19-year-old woman allegedly committed statutory rape with a 13-year-old boy. Both she and the person who arranged the meeting are now in the Madison County Jail.
Some public schools in Indiana are struggling to find the funding for adequate medical care for their students. State law requires that all Indiana public schools have nurses available.
A new bill in the Indiana General Assembly would ban unsolicited faxes. A similar law for telephones led to the formation of the Indiana Attorney General's Do Not Call list.
19 traffic accidents occured in Delaware County, Indiana before 10 AM on January 18, 2006. A combination of snow and ice made the roads especially hazardous.
Weather.

College students do better in their first few years of college if they graduated from college-prep private schools than if they graduated from non-college-prep public schools, according to a recent study.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2006-01-16
description: The City of Anderson, Indiana celebrated Martin Luther King, Jr. Day with speeches by several Indiana legislators and a reading of Dr. King's famous "I have a dream" speech.
Local hospitals are creating emergency plans to address the possibility of an avian influenza pandemic.

Part of the City of Muncie, Indiana's celebration of Martin Luther King, Jr. Day was its annual "Ask a Lawyer Day". The event allows persons who cannot afford legal advice to seek free advice from local lawyers. AALD is sponsored by the Muncie Bar Association and the Indiana Bar Association.
Weather.
Republican Mitch Daniels, Governor of Indiana, would like for employers to offer reduced health insurance rates to their employees who are non-smokers.
NewsLink Indiana shares tips with its viewers on how to establish a regular exercise regimen.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2006-02-09
description: A middle school teacher has resigned from the Randolph Central School Corporation for undisclosed reasons. The teacher was recently investigated by the Winchester Police Department.
A documentary film about WIPB-TV in Muncie, Indiana will air on WIPB-TV on February 9, 2006.

Authorities are investigating a possible case of mail fraud reported by a resident of Muncie, Indiana. The resident claims to have received a letter promising them a large sum of money, in exchange for a check to be sent to the sender of the letter.
A Holocaust survivor will give a presentation at the New Castle Middle School in New Castle, Indiana.

Some Indiana high school students may earn up to two years of college credit while they are still in high school. The program is a joint initiative of Anderson University in Anderson, Indiana and the Charles A. Tindley Accelerated School in Indianapolis, Indiana.
The City of Dunkirk, Indiana will build four new homes with recently-received grant monies. The homes will be made available to families in need of temporary financial assistance.
Weather.

GAP Limited offers financial assistance and legal advice to relatives acting as the primary caregivers of children who are not their own. The organization was founded by a grandparent living in South Bend, Indiana in 2003.

description: The Indiana State Budget Agency's State Budget Committee has approved funding for Ivy Tech Community College in Marion, Indiana to build a new campus near I-69 and State Road 18.

Over 500 Indiana junior high school students attended the Junior High Journalism Day hosted by the Ball State University Department of Journalism. The students attended sessions on different aspects of journalism, learning new journalistic techniques to use in their schools' publications.
Weather.
Residents and businesses in Muncie, Indiana are preparing for the 2005 Christmas season.

WIPB-TV of Muncie, Indiana held a fundraising telesale on November 2, 2005. Some of the items offered for callers to bid on were a day with the fire chief of the Center Township Fire Department, a body piercing, and a tattoo from The Lucky Rabbit of Muncie, Indiana.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2005-12-06
description: Faculty and students at Anderson University in Anderson, Indiana created a memorial bust of Democrat Frank O'Bannon, former Governor of Indiana. Governor O'Bannon died of a stroke while still in office in September 2003.

The Board of Commissioners of Delaware County, Indiana have delayed voting on a proposal that would ban smoking in public places in Delaware County, Indiana. The Board is studying legal issues related to the proposed ban.

The Muncie Sanitary District held a public forum on December 6, 2005 to discuss a proposed hike in sewer rates. Funds raised by the proposed hike would be used to rebuild the sewer systems in Muncie, Indiana.
Researchers from the Indiana Department of Agriculture, Purdue University, and Ball State University will discuss the effects of agriculture on the economy and the environment on December 7, 2005.
Cowan High School has been asked to rename their athletic teams and change their mascot. The CHS Blackhawks and their Chief Blackhawk have been criticized by some Native American organizations.
Weather.
North View Elementary School in Muncie, Indiana has organized a school-wide hand-washing campaign. NVES hopes the campaign will reduce the incidence of illness among students and faculty.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2005-10-05
description: A local man died after being severely burned at the former Thompson SA plant in Marion, Indiana. A series of fires and explosions erupted at the building after a live wire was accidentally severed.

The Madison County Sheriff's Department is still looking for the corpses of two female murder victims. Kenneth Powers has confessed to both murders, and claims that the victims' bodies are buried in Madison County, Indiana.
Xtreme Alternative Defense Systems of Anderson, Indiana has won awards for two of its non-lethal directed energy weapons. XADS hopes to market their NLDEW products to the United States Armed Forces.
Weather.
A human case of West Nile virus has been confirmed in Madison County, Indiana. The victim is suspected to have contracted WNV during a bike ride in Ohio.

A food pantry in Marion, Indiana will be sponsoring free nutrition classes by Purdue University. The classes will encourage healthy eating habits, based on recommendations from MyPyramid by the United States Department of Agriculture.
Good's Candy Shop in Anderson, Indiana has found its second Willy Wonka Golden Ticket winner.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2005-12-04
description: Detective Terry Sollars has resigned his position with the Anderson Police Department.
Brian Lough has resigned his position as Director of the Muncie Downtown Development Partnership.
The Madison County Government Center in Anderson, Indiana is receiving an upgrade to their telephone system. The MCGC's old system had been plagued with problems recently.

The principal of Justice Thurgood Marshall Intermediate School in Marion, Indiana is retiring. He has accepted a position as the property manager of the Asherwood Environmental Science Center in Wabash, Indiana. Both JTMIS and AESC are administered by Marion Community Schools.

Anderson Indiana Main Street held its Winterfest 2005 on December 4, 2005 in Anderson, Indiana. Multiple locations hosted a variety of events, culminating with a tree lighting in Citizens Plaza Park. Winterfest celebrates the official beginning of the holiday season in downtown Anderson, Indiana.
Weather.
Local vocalists are preparing for the 69th annual Muncie Community Christmas Sing. The MCCS will be held in the Muncie Fieldhouse in Muncie, Indiana in mid-December 2005.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2005-03-17
description: Three residents of Anderson, Indiana have become victims of advance-fee fraud. The victims were promised large amounts of cash in the near future, in exchange for a small amount of cash in the present, via emails claiming to be sent from Nigeria.
A man was arrested for allegedly viewing child pornography at a Muncie Public Library branch in Muncie, Indiana.

A judge in Madison County, Indiana has ruled that the psychiatric records for Frederick Baer will not be released to the public before Baer's murder trial. The judge hopes to avoid contaminating the jury pool. Baer had unsuccessfully attempted to plead guilty but mentally ill last week, before changing his plea to not guilty this week.
The owners of several independent garages in Portland, Indiana worry about the effect that a planned Wal-Mart store will have on their businesses.
The staff of the Lakeview Restaurant in Dublin, Indiana celebrated St. Patrick's Day on March 17, 2005. Several people affiliated with the restaurant have relatives living in Ireland.
Weather.
Students from Ball State University will host an online field trip to the National Museum of the American Indian on March 22, 2005.

originalRecord.title: Newslink Indiana video 2004-04-28
originalRecord.coverage: Muncie; Delaware County; Indiana; United States; North and Central America;
description: Many residents of Delaware County, Indiana are uneasy about a proposed wheel tax. Proceeds from the proposed wheel tax would be used to fix roads in Delaware County, Indiana.
A grand jury in Delaware County, Indiana is investigating the Royerton Sewer Project.
Weather.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2005-02-10
description: A vehicle belonging to Tom Saunders, Indiana State Representative for District 54, may have been involved in a hit-and-run traffic accident that killed Thomas Jackman of New Castle, Indiana on February 4, 2005. The New Castle Police Department has impounded the car.

Muncie Community Schools plans to eliminate faculty, staff, and administration positions. MCS is also considering increasing class sizes. Both initiatives would address planned cuts in state funding for public K-12 education, which MCS estimates would cost them $2.3 million dollars over the next two years.

The County Clerk of the Circuit Court in Delaware County, Indiana held a voting fair on February 10, 2005 at the Horizon Convention Center in Muncie, Indiana. Attendees were able to try and comment upon different voting machines being showcased by several voting machine manufacturers.

New traffic lights were installed at the intersection of McGalliard Road and Tillotson Avenue in Muncie, Indiana. A brief traffic jam resulted when motorists were denied access to several lanes on both streets.
A vehicle slid off of White River Boulevard in Muncie, Indiana due to slick, snowy driving conditions.
