sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2005-11-22
description: The Board of Commissioners of Delaware County, Indiana voted to approve the re-zoning of 800 acres in Shideler, Indiana. The rezoning would allow a soy, diesel, or ethanol plant to be built on the site in the future. Some residents of Shideler oppose the possibility of a such a plant.
The General Motors Company has confirmed that it will not be closing its metal fabricating plant in Marion, Indiana. The Marion Metal Center currently has over 2500 employees.
The Director of the Indiana State Department of Agriculture has officially apologized for a letter he wrote to The Board of Commissioners of Blackford County, Indiana.
A recent proposal calls for the construction of a new park in downtown Muncie, Indiana. Local businesses are embracing the idea.
Students at Ball State University's Center for Media Design helped researchers study the initial reactions of video game players to the Microsoft Xbox 360.
Weather.
The United Way of Delaware County, Indiana announced that they have reached their goal for donations in 2005.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2005-11-10
description: A teenager from Albany, Indiana remains in critical condition after a traffic accident on State Road 67 on November 9, 2010. The accident occurred on a stretch of SR 67 known as "Dead Man's Curve".
The Muncie Police Department believes that they have found the man responsible for a 70-minute long series of crimes on November 7, 2005. A convenience store clerk was shot during the spree.

The Muncie Fire Department has received approval from the Muncie Common Council to reallocate some of its funds. The MFD will transfer money from its safety budget to its maintenance and repair budget, which was unusually low.
Businesses in Muncie, Indiana are preparing for the 2005 holiday shopping season.
Weather.
Architects are finishing plans for a $19 million renovation to the Muncie Southside High School in Muncie, Indiana. The renovation is expected to take two years.

The Post Office in Gaston, Indiana has become a gathering place for local residents. The United States Postal Service does not offer home delivery in Gaston, Indiana, so local residents must visit the Post Office to retrieve their mail.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2004-07-21
description: One man was killed and one man was seriously injured in an automobile accident just west of Anderson, Indiana. Brian Reno died at the scene while trapped in a burning vehicle. Samuel Jack was freed from a vehicle and airlifted to Methodist Hospital of Indianapolis, Indiana.

Walmart will not be given any tax incentives for locating its new building on the south side of Muncie, Indiana. The East 29th Street location should open in the spring of 2006, and will employ approximately 450 people.

The Randolph Farms Landfill in Modoc, Indiana has reduced its proposed expansion plans by almost half. The landfill currently covers 120 acres, and had originally hoped to expand by an additional 200 acres.
Weather.

originalRecord.title: Newslink Indiana video 2004-07-06
originalRecord.coverage: Muncie; Delaware County; Indiana; United States; North and Central America;
description: Senator John Kerry, Democratic candidate for President of the United States, is attending the General Conference of the African Methodist Episcopal Church in Indianapolis, Indiana.

The 2004 Control Line World Championships will be held in Muncie, Indiana. Thousands of people from 28 countries will be participating in the model aircraft competition - including Scott Matson of Muncie, Indiana.
Weather.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2006-02-23
description: Crime rates on the campus of Ball State University increased in 2005. Most other universities in Indiana saw their on-campus crime rates drop in 2005.
One church in Muncie, Indiana is protesting Muncie Gras 2006. The event, which serves as a fundraiser for local charities, is scheduled for February 26, 2006.
The Indiana Department of Correction has fired the superintendent of the Pendleton Juvenile Correctional Facility in Pendleton, Indiana.
Residents of Marion, Indiana are collaborating to build a women's shelter in Marion, Indiana.
A resident of Randolph County, Indiana was left homeless after a fire destroyed his home.
An elderly woman who has been hospitalized for 23 years has been convicted of a decades-old murder. The 72-year-old resident of Anderson, Indiana will soon be sentenced.
Weather.

The Indiana Senate has voted against a bill that would have allowed Indiana wineries to ship their wine to Indiana residents. The owners of many Indiana wineries worry that increasing regulation will harm their businesses.

A program at Wilson Middle School in Muncie, Indiana used music to teach students the skills they will need for the Indiana Statewide Testing for Educational Progress standardized tests. All involved hope that Rap, Rhythm and Rhyme will improve ISTEP+ scores.
A new local endowment fund will guarantee an additional $5,000 donation every year to The Marine Toys for Tots Foundation.

description: Republican Mitch Daniels, Governor of Indiana, visited Ball State University in Muncie, Indiana.
An Alexandria Police Department officer has been arrested for soliciting sex.
The last escapee from the Henry County Jail has been captured in Florida. Roscoe Fry escaped the HCJ on September 28, 2005 with three other prisoners.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2005-03-10
description: Five pit bull puppies were seized from a local house during a drug bust. Authorities suspect that the puppies may have been intended for eventual use in dogfights.

Residents of Muncie, Indiana voiced their opinions about proposed budget cuts by Muncie Community Schools. MCS is planning to eliminate positions, increase class sizes, discontinue some classes, and disband its arts programs. All of those moves would address planned cuts in state funding for public K-12 education, which MCS estimates would cost them millions of dollars over the next two years.
The Richmond Apothecary in Richmond, Indiana was robbed at gunpoint. The robber was seeking OxyContin, an opioid analgesic medication synthesized from opium-derived thebaine.

The Pendleton Police Department will begin ticketing truck drivers who drive through Pendleton, Indiana's historic downtown area. A measure banning semi-trailer truck traffic there was passed by Pendleton's Town Council in November 2004, but was not being aggressively enforced.
Republican Richard Lugar, Senator from Indiana, has co-sponsored a bill to authorize additional funding for research on Alzheimer's disease.
Weather.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2004-08-24
description: Two young children were rescued after they wandered out of the house where they were being cared for. They were found attempting to cross Nebo Road, a busy street near Muncie, Indiana.

Republican Dan Canan, Mayor of Muncie, Indiana, has partially rescinded a ban on flying any flag at the Prairie Creek Reservoir and Campground. Campers will now be allowed to fly American flags or POW/MIA flags. Mayor Canan apologized to campers, and explained that the City of Muncie, Indiana plans on implementing new rules about flags for the Campground in 2005.
Weather.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2006-03-03
description: A local man was found guilty in the shooting death of a teenager from Yorktown, Indiana in 2000.
A jury in Blackford County, Indiana is deliberating in the case of a man accused of fatally stabbing a Montpelier, Indiana man.

Cannon Industries, the industrial division of Hillcroft Services Inc., employs hundreds of adults with disabilities to provide subcontract work for businesses in Indiana. CI has locations in Franklin, Muncie and New Castle, Indiana.
High energy costs and fertilizer costs are negatively effecting local farmers.

Eighth graders at Delta Middle School in Muncie, Indiana are participating in a fundraiser for the Animal Rescue Fund of Muncie, Indiana. The students are creating artwork, selling that artwork, and then donating the proceeds to ARF.
Weather.
Clean-up efforts in the wake of Muncie Gras 2006 are now complete. Muncie Gras 2006 was held on February 24, 2006 and February 25, 2006.

A local author visited Storer Elementary School in Muncie, Indiana to read the students an educational story about cancer. Two SES teachers celebrated the occasion by cutting their hair, which they subsequently donated to Locks of Love.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2006-01-20
description: An SUV flipped over during a traffic accident in Muncie, Indiana. No one was seriously injured.
Indiana residents in need of human services may dial 2-1-1 beginning in March 2006. The initiative will be implemented by the Indiana 211 Partnership, Inc., a nonprofit organization.
Many Indiana residents will apply for a refund anticipation loan after filing their taxes. Such loans provide immediate access to a taxpayer's refund monies, in exchange for a fee.
A group of health officials met at Taylor University in Upland, Indiana to discuss avian influenza.
Weather.

FidoProducts of Indianapolis, Indiana has introduced a new product - The FidoRido. The FidoRido serves as a combination booster seat and restraint system for dogs riding in automobiles. It can also be converted into a pet carrier, a pet bed, or a pet bathtub.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2006-02-03
description: Taylor University in Upland, Indiana has partnered with World Vision to send educational information about AIDS to at-risk communities in multiple countries. World Vision is a Christian relief, development and advocacy organization dedicated to working with children, families and communities to overcome poverty and injustice.
A two-vehicle traffic accident near the Muncie Bypass led to traffic delays in Muncie, Indiana.

The Delaware County Health Department and the American Heart Association jointly sponsored a Go Red for Women event on February 3, 2006 in Muncie, Indiana. The event was designed to raise awareness about heart disease and stroke in women.

A new computer worm was discovered on January 16, 2006. The Kama Sutra worm is designed to destroy common files such as Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint documents when each computer's calendar hit February 3, and on the 3rd of each following month. The worm is predominantly disseminated via unsolicited email attachments, usually claiming to contain erotic pictures.
Weather.
Republican Mike Pence, the U.S. Representative for Indiana's 6th district, has announced that he will seek re-election during the 2006 House elections.
Local sports bars are preparing for Super Bowl XL on February 5, 2006. The AFC's Pittsburgh Steelers are currently favored by four points over the NFC's Seattle Seahawks.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2005-11-14
description: The Muncie Police Department is investigating a shooting in downtown Muncie, Indiana that killed one person. Three people have already been arrested, and the MPD is seeking one other person of interest. The MPD believes the shooting was the result of a drug deal gone wrong.
A member of the United States Marine Corps from New Castle, Indiana was killed near Fallujah, Al Anbar Province, Iraq. The Marine was killed by a roadside bomb while serving in the Iraq War.
A twelve-year old boy from Richmond, Indiana has been charged with attempted murder. The boy allegedly placed a degreaser into a teacher's cup of coffee in October 2005.
The City of Muncie, Indiana's S.W.A.T. team has received a new unmarked vehicle for transporting its members. The bus they had been using has mechanical problems.

Animal rights activist Jill Dolon met with actress Linda Blair in New Mexico to rescue eight pit bulls. Both Dolan's Unconditional Love Foundation and the Linda Blair WorldHeart Foundation are involved in animal rights causes.
Weather.
The Corinth Congregational Christian Church in Muncie, Indiana is collecting gifts to send to children in Iraq and Afghanistan.

NewsLink staff can be found covering Grant, Blackford, Jay, Randolph, Wayne, Henry, Madison and Delaware counties.
collection.title: Newslink Indiana Videos

originalRecord.title: Newslink Indiana video 2005-11-14
originalRecord.coverage: Muncie; Delaware County; Indiana; United States; North and Central America;
description: The Muncie Police Department is investigating a shooting in downtown Muncie, Indiana that killed one person. Three people have already been arrested, and the MPD is seeking one other person of interest. The MPD believes the shooting was the result of a drug deal gone wrong.
A member of the United States Marine Corps from New Castle, Indiana was killed near Fallujah, Al Anbar Province, Iraq. The Marine was killed by a roadside bomb while serving in the Iraq War.
A twelve-year old boy from Richmond, Indiana has been charged with attempted murder. The boy allegedly placed a degreaser into a teacher's cup of coffee in October 2005.
The City of Muncie, Indiana's S.W.A.T. team has received a new unmarked vehicle for transporting its members. The bus they had been using has mechanical problems.

Animal rights activist Jill Dolon met with actress Linda Blair in New Mexico to rescue eight pit bulls. Both Dolan's Unconditional Love Foundation and the Linda Blair WorldHeart Foundation are involved in animal rights causes.
Weather.
The Corinth Congregational Christian Church in Muncie, Indiana is collecting gifts to send to children in Iraq and Afghanistan.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2006-01-04
description: Democrat Dennis A. Tyler has been sworn into the Indiana House of Representatives. Tyler is assuming the seat in Muncie, Indiana vacated by the late Tiny Adams. Tyler will represent the 34th District.
The City of Muncie, Indiana's 911 call center will be replaced by the Delaware County Emergency Communications Center. The DCECC will include new equipment and new technology.
The Housing Choice Voucher Program (a.k.a. Section 8) allows recipients to receive benefits while going to school. Recipients may also choose where they live.
The government of Delaware County, Indiana has created the Ag Bio Vision Park near Shideler, Indiana.
The future of the Randolph County Courthouse in Winchester, Indiana remains uncertain. A petition to demolish the Courthouse was widely circulated in December 2005.
Weather.

The Rose Bowl bowling alley in New Castle, Indiana recently began a self-imposed smoking ban. Patrons and employees may not smoke inside the Rose Bowl on Fridays, Saturdays or Sundays. The smoking ban resulted from patron requests.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2005-12-08
description: The Anderson Street Department is preparing for snow and ice on roads in the Anderson, Indiana area.
Weather.

Friends and acquaintances of Tiny Adams reflect on his service to east-central Indiana. The recently-deceased Adams was a Democratic member of the Indiana House of Representatives, representing Muncie, Indiana.
An open forum was held to discuss the proposed smoking ban for Delaware County, Indiana on December 7, 2005.
Ball State University's new athletic director, Tom Collins, toured BSU's campus facilities. Collins is planning to begin meeting with BSU faculty and staff later in December 2005.

The post office in Pendleton, Indiana has dedicated a special mailbox for letters from children to Santa Claus. Some of the letters may be reprinted in The Pendleton Times-Post, a weekly newspaper serving Pendleton, Indiana and its surrounding communities.
Weather.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2005-09-28
description: The Muncie Police Department is investigating gunshots that were fired at the Windermere Place apartment complex's clubhouse in Muncie, Indiana.
Two teenagers who escaped from the Youth Opportunity Center in Muncie, Indiana were apprehended in Michigan. The teenagers allegedly led police on a high-speed chase while driving a stolen car.
NewsLink Indiana shares tips on how to safely light one's furnace.
The Indiana Bureau of Motor Vehicles has adopted a new written test and a new driving skills test for would-be school bus drivers.
A Red Cross volunteer who recently returned from storm-ravaged Mississippi talks about his experiences during the relief effort.
Weather.

A trucking company is offering a cash reward for the return of over 36,000 pounds of stolen candy. Both the candy and the semi-trailer truck transporting it were stolen in Cambridge City, Indiana in August 2005.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2006-03-20
description: Authorities in Anderson, Indiana used a missing criminal's cell phone to trace his location. The criminal had confessed to rape, murder and arson in Anderson, Indiana.

The Muncie Central High School boys' basketball team will play Lawrence North High School in the finals of the Indiana High School Athletic Association's Class 4A 2005-2006 State Tournament. LNHS is playing for their third consecutive state championship in the 4A division, which includes the most populous high schools in the State of Indiana.
A man from Muncie, Indiana man was fatally shot during a brawl at a local Village Pantry convenience store on March 19, 2006.
A new bill in the Indiana House of Representatives would allocate up to $39 million dollars to Ball State University for improvements to campus recreational facilities.
Weather.
Some local businesspeople fear that the new Wal-Mart store on the south side of Muncie, Indiana will have a negative effect on their businesses.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2005-11-17
description: The Anderson Police Department has arrested three persons accused of operating a car theft ring.
A Marion, Indiana man has been sentenced to eighteen months of probation for spanking a child in 2003. His spankings were hard enough to leave bruises on the child.
Farmers can use a new GPS-powered system to keep track of how much fertilizer they have applied in a given area. The system can also be programmed to steer the vehicles used to spread the fertilizer.
CiCi's Pizza and Papa Murphy's both plan to open new stores in Marion, Indiana. The pizzerias will be located in a developing shopping complex near a Starbucks coffeehouse.
Local temperatures dropped rapidly on November 17, 2005. Drastic changes in weather are common late in the year in the Midwest.
Weather.
The Muncie Humane Society is overcrowded with stray animals.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2006-01-30
description: A domestic shooting in Muncie, Indiana sent one man to the Ball Memorial Hospital and his ex-girlfriend to the Delaware County Jail.

The Delaware County Board of Health will vote on a proposal that would ban smoking in public places in Delaware County, Indiana. If the DCBH approves the proposal, it would then be voted on by The Board of Commissioners of Delaware County, Indiana.

The City of Muncie, Indiana and the Town of Yorktown, Indiana are going to court against each other. The City of Muncie, Indiana is protesting a petition by the Town of Yorktown, Indiana to annex additional land and housing communities.
The standardized testing requirements in the No Child Left Behind Act of 2001 are flawed, according to a recent study by four professors at Ball State University.
Members of the Anderson Fire Department and the White River Athletic Club in Anderson, Indiana will act as models for a calendar. Proceeds earned by the calendars will be donated to charity.

Clancy's Car Wash Inc. is drilling a non-commercial well beneath their Muncie, Indiana location. CCWI hopes to tap into natural gas reserves in The Trenton Field, which it would use to heat its building and water.
Weather.
The Edgewood Golf Club in Anderson, Indiana is being renovated by its new management.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2005-02-18
description: The Delaware-Muncie Metropolitan Plan Commission is working with the Federal Railroad Administration on a plan to curb railroad noise. The proposal would create a quiet-zone in downtown Muncie, Indiana.
Ball State University has codified its desire for freshmen to live on or near campus. All BSU freshmen are now required to live within a 60 mile radius of the Muncie, Indiana campus.
People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals is offering a a reward for information about the killing and dumping of a pit bull in South Muncie, Indiana.
Some police in east-central Indiana wish that civilians were not able to purchase tasers. Civilians may purchase tasers without completing any training or undergoing background checks.
Repairs on a 55-foot sinkhole in Richmond, Indiana are almost complete.
Weather.
Wuzzy Bear teaches students at Royerton Elementary School about proper nutrition, exercise, and health.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2005-02-15
description: Police in Redkey, Indiana have released surveillance video of an attempted abduction in a convenience store in Redkey, Indiana. The alleged abductor, Wayne C. Melton, has since checked into Ball Memorial Hospital in Muncie, Indiana for treatment of unspecified mental health problems.
Meals on Wheels of Muncie, Inc. will soon undergo a computer upgrade. MWM hopes that the upgrade will increase the efficiency of both their office work and field operations.

The Minnetrista Cultural Center in Muncie, Indiana is celebrating the premier of a documentary film about Catalyst, a large dichroic glass, stainless steel and limestone sculpture on the MCC's grounds. The film was produced by students at Ball State University.

The Delaware County Emergency Management Agency and Ball State University are collaborating to encourage safe behavior during severe weather. The two organizations are co-presenting free workshops on storm-spotting, understanding storm systems, and how to notify authorities about approaching severe weather conditions.
Blackford County United Way Inc. raised $93,000 dollars in 2004, surpassing its original goal by $8,000.
The City of Portland's Streets and Parks Department explains how federal grants have aided its cleanup efforts after the ice storm in January 2005.
Weather.
This Old Barn Bed & Breakfast offers guests comfortable surroundings, made-from-scratch meals, and a quiet getaway from city life in Upland, Indiana.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2006-01-12
description: A resident of Muncie, Indiana committed suicide in front of members of the Muncie Police Department. The man allegedly shot his wife twice, then shot himself after being confronted by the MPD.
Two people had to be cut from their automobile after a traffic accident in downtown Muncie, Indiana.
Republican Mitch Daniels, Governor of Indiana, delivered his second State of the State Address. Topics included the cost of health care and youth anti-smoking initiatives.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2006-03-16
description: Ball State University's head men's basketball coach has been reassigned, following the Cardinals' disappointing 10-18 record in the 2005-2006 season. Tim Buckley will be moved to BSU's University Development office, which raises funds to support the educational mission of BSU. Buckley was an assistant coach at BSU under Ray McCallum from 1994-1999, then head coach from 2000-2006.

The Major Moves initiative has now been approved by both the Indiana House of Representatives and the Indiana Senate. Major Moves call for the State of Indiana to lease the Indiana East-West Toll Road to private companies. The funds generated by the leasing would be applied toward a 10-year, $12 billion plan to significantly improve and expand Indianaâs highway infrastructure.
Republican Mitch Daniels, Governor of Indiana, invited reporters to the Indiana Statehouse on March 15, 2006 to discuss the recently concluded short session of the Indiana General Assembly.
Bus drivers in Anderson, Indiana are being negatively effected by rising fuel prices.

Entertainer Ed McMahon joined Dan Canan, Mayor of Muncie, Indiana at the ribbon-cutting for the Royal Crown Hold'Em Club in Muncie, Indiana. The poker club is located in a renovated building in downtown Muncie, Indiana.
Weather.
The True Bay Group played traditional Irish folk music at the Muncie Public Library's Carnegie Library branch in downtown Muncie, Indiana.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2006-01-25
description: A predicate felon from Muncie, Indiana has been sentenced to life imprisonment without the possibility of parole. Ronald A. Hatfield was found guilty of the murder of an employee at the Rickers gas station on Memorial Street in Muncie, Indiana on December 16, 2004.

A freshman at Ball State University attempted to steal books from a local bookstore. The student hid in the bookstore until after its closing. The student was caught when he inadvertently triggered the security alarm.
A Grant County, Indiana man led police on an extended chase through Grant County, Indiana and Hamilton County, Indiana. He ultimately eluded the police. The police have since located his automobile.

An unusual form of school disciplinary action has been discontinued after a local student was injured. Troublesome students will no longer be forced to carry a large crate full of supplies with them for their entire school day.
Weather.

Weather.
The Walnut Crossing food court in downtown Muncie, Indiana is preparing for the 2005 holiday season.
The new James Dean Gallery in Gas City, Indiana is closing, despite being open for only a year.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2005-03-04
description: Damian Sanders has admitted to fatally shooting Ball State University student Karl Harford in spring 2004. Sanders was given the maximum sentence of 85 years in prison.

The newly-formed City-County Council for People with Disabilities hopes to improve transportation, accessibility, and employment opportunities for persons with disabilities in Muncie, Indiana and Delaware County, Indiana.
Mutual Federal Savings Bank of Muncie, Indiana hopes to purchase Fidelity Federal Savings Bank of Marion, Indiana. The proposed sale awaits approval by federal regulators.
The rising price of natural gas will require the average farmer in east-central Indiana to pay $10,000 more in production costs in 2005 than they did in 2004, according to local farmers.

A local high school student has been picked to direct a portion of a television program shown daily in high schools nationwide. Kurtis Cummings is a senior at Yorktown High school, focusing on telecommunications.
Weather.
Buddy Love, an ex-convict who now runs a barber shop, hopes to provide a positive influence to his patrons.

description: The Indiana Horse Racing Commission will allow Indiana betting parlors to continue showing live simulcasts of races in Kentucky. sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2004-08-18
description: Parents of children at Morrison-Mock Elementary School voiced their concerns about the possible closing of MMES at a public forum on August 17, 2004. Weather.

originalRecord.title: Newslink Indiana video 2004-10-13
originalRecord.coverage: Muncie; Delaware County; Indiana; United States; North and Central America;
description: There is still a shortage of influenza vaccine in the local area. In response, many consumers are turning to herbal remedies to boost their immune systems.
The City of Anderson, Indiana is planning to add additional lighting to its downtown area. Underground electrical lines will also be made available to downtown businesses.
Weather.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2005-02-01
description: Republican Dan Canan, Mayor of Muncie, Indiana, delivered his 2005 State of the City address. Topics of discussion included a tax for those who work in Muncie, Indiana but do not live in Muncie, Indiana, a local sales tax on goods purchased in Muncie, Indiana, and possible tuition increases at Ball State University.
The government of Delaware County, Indiana will receive funding from the Federal Emergency Management Agency to aid its clean-up efforts after the recent ice storm.

A man that was arrested as a suspect in the fire at Advanced Magnesium Alloys Corporation in Anderson, Indiana has been released. The man, who was found at AMACOR with a hand-held fire extinguisher attempting to put out the massive fire, is no longer a suspect.

The Internal Revenue Service's Volunteer Income Tax Assistance program is offering free tax help to low- and moderate-income people who cannot prepare their own tax returns. The local coordinator for VITA is Paul Parkison, a retired Ball State University accounting professor.
Poet Derrick Slack began the Minnetrista Cultural Center's celebration of Black History Month 2005 with a poetry reading centered around hope.
Weather.

The Consumer Bankers Association, a national trade organization for retail banks, is challenging the legality of the State of Indiana's Do Not Call list. The list as presently defined prevents the CBA's member organizations from cold-calling consumers.

originalRecord.coverage: Muncie; Delaware County; Indiana; United States; North and Central America;
description: Republican Dan Canan, Mayor of Muncie, Indiana, delivered his 2005 State of the City address. Topics of discussion included a tax for those who work in Muncie, Indiana but do not live in Muncie, Indiana, a local sales tax on goods purchased in Muncie, Indiana, and possible tuition increases at Ball State University.
The government of Delaware County, Indiana will receive funding from the Federal Emergency Management Agency to aid its clean-up efforts after the recent ice storm.

A man that was arrested as a suspect in the fire at Advanced Magnesium Alloys Corporation in Anderson, Indiana has been released. The man, who was found at AMACOR with a hand-held fire extinguisher attempting to put out the massive fire, is no longer a suspect.

The Internal Revenue Service's Volunteer Income Tax Assistance program is offering free tax help to low- and moderate-income people who cannot prepare their own tax returns. The local coordinator for VITA is Paul Parkison, a retired Ball State University accounting professor.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2005-02-14
description: Thousands of homes and businesses in Muncie, Indiana briefly lost power on the afternoon of February 14, 2005. Indiana Michigan Power had to temporarily shut down power along McGalliard Road in Muncie, Indiana to fix a malfunctioning transformer.

The New Castle Police Department has issued additional subpoenas related to a hit-and-run traffic accident that killed Thomas Jackman of New Castle, Indiana on February 4, 2005. Andrew Saunders, the son of Indiana State Representative for District 54 Tom Saunders, is listed as a person of interest.
A Marion, Indiana man has been sentenced to three years in jail. Roger Randolph was involved in a shooting at a bar in Madison County, Indiana in August 2004.

The first phase of renovations to the New Castle-Henry County Public Library is now complete. The NCHCPL now includes a larger children's reading room, a 180-seat auditorium, and an Indiana history study room.

The Anderson Community School Corporation may be forced to lay off 50+ teachers, eliminate certain classes and/or increase classroom sizes. Those initiatives would address planned cuts in state funding for public K-12 education, which ACSC estimates would cost them millions of dollars.
A local dog appears to have been attacked by a coyote. The possibility of coyote attacks has some local residents fearful for the safety of their own pets.
Weather.
Landmark Village Florist of Muncie, Indiana explains what a typical Valentine's Day means for their business.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2005-01-20
description: Officials of Delaware County, Indiana met to discuss the recent ice storm, focusing especially on their communities' responses and ways to improve their collective disaster preparedness.

The Scholastic Aptitude Test will be significantly revised for the first time since 1994. There will be major changes to the Math and Critical Reading sections, and a new Writing section has been added. The new version of the SAT, known as the SAT Reasoning Test, will be first offered on March 12, 2005.
A fire at Pleasant Valley Community Church in Middletown, Indiana brought its congregation together to celebrate in the midst of tragedy.

Officials from Advanced Magnesium Alloys Corporation claim that residents living near their magnesium recycling facility in Anderson, Indiana were not exposed to toxic fumes during a fire at the AMACOR plant last week.
Weather
Marsh Supermarket now offers small-game hunting and fishing licenses through the Indiana Department of Natural Resources.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2005-02-17
description: Andrew Saunders, the son of Indiana State Representative for District 54 Tom Saunders, has turned himself into the New Castle Police Department. The NCPD had issued an arrest warrant for Andrew, who may have been involved in a hit-and-run traffic accident that killed Thomas Jackman of New Castle, Indiana on February 4, 2005.

The City of Anderson, Indiana has requested assistance from the Indiana Department of Environmental Management with clean-up efforts after a fire at the Advanced Magnesium Alloys Corporation plant in Anderson, Indiana in January 2005. They fear that residents in nearby neighborhoods could be exposed to asbestos or other harmful substances during the AMACOR clean-up process.
Wayne C. Melton has been released from the Jay County Jail after his family posted bail. Melton allegedly attempted to abduct a convenience store employee in Redkey, Indiana.

Richmond Parks and Recreation has requested over four years worth of back rent from the Richmond Roosters, a Frontier League professional baseball team. The Roosters have played their home games at the city-owned Don McBride Stadium in Richmond, Indiana since 1995.
The Indiana General Assembly is considering a proposal that would allow some Indiana preschoolers to begin attending kindergarten at a younger age.
Weather.
The First Baptist Church in New Castle, Indiana has purchased and renovated a former Wal-Mart store in New Castle, Indiana, which will serve as their new church building.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2005-01-17
description: The Town of Yorktown, Indiana is under a boil-water advisory after a 12-inch water main broke on January 16, 2005.

1,500 residents of Anderson, Indiana were evacuated from their homes after a fire at the Advanced Magnesium Alloys Corporation plant in Anderson, Indiana. Investigators say the fire may have been caused by broken pipes at AMACOR, the largest magnesium recycling facility in the world.
An abandoned railroad bridge is in danger of collapsing in Richmond, Indiana. A large sinkhole, which was due to be repaired over a month ago, is threatening the bridge's structural integrity.

The Town of Lapel, Indiana was forced to shut off all of its local gas utility lines on January 16, 2005 after their pipes froze. Utility crews are going door-to-door to turn resident's gas lines back on.
Weather.

The City of Anderson, Indiana celebrated Martin Luther King Day with a program at the Paramount Theatre Centre & Ballroom in Anderson, Indiana. Speakers included Rev. Lawrence Haygood, an aide to Dr. King during the African-American Civil Rights Movement.

originalRecord.title: Newslink Indiana video 2004-10-29
originalRecord.coverage: Muncie; Delaware County; Indiana; United States; North and Central America;
description: The Hagerstown-Jefferson Township Public Library's Hagerstown Library branch is the fourth best public library in the country, according to rankings in American Libraries Magazine. Hagerstown Library was so honored because of their large collections, well-appointed facilities, abundant electronic access, and holiday events.

A new law will decrease the amount of time that it takes for checks to clear. The Check Clearing Act mandates that electronic images of checks be exchanged between banks, rather than waiting for the physical checks to arrive.
Weather.

A group of Ukrainian students at Ball State University are upset about the recently completed Ukrainian presidential election of 2004, which is widely believed to have been rigged in favor of Prime Minister Viktor Yanukovych. The aggrieved students have collected $300 in donations to send to protesters in the Ukraine, who believe that opposition candidate Viktor Yushchenko was the rightful winner.
Weather.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2004-09-22
description: Steve Carter, Attorney General of Indiana, has ruled that Earlham College must release the financial records relating to its separation from the Conner Prairie Museum. Both entities are laying claim to an endowment from pharmaceutical executive Eli Lilly, who originally left the facilities of Conner Prairie to a public charitable trust, of which Earlham College was the trustee.
Karen Wenger, Clerk of the Circuit Court, is preparing to oversee and conduct the 2004 elections in Delaware County, Indiana. Wenger has tallied 14 elections during her 9 years in office.
The Anderson YWCA lost over $20,000 due to poor attendance at a recent Sha Na Na concert. 2,000 people were expected, but only 300 actually came.
Weather.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2005-01-25
description: Investigators have concluded that the fire at the Advanced Magnesium Alloys Corporation in Anderson, Indiana was a case of arson.
Wal-Mart Stores, Inc. has announced that it will build a new perishable food distribution center in Gas City, Indiana. The center would bring 600 new jobs to the Gas City, Indiana area.
The High Street Bridge in Muncie, Indiana is being renovated. Planned improvements include a safer pedestrian walkways and concrete cantilevers.
Funeral services were held for George Gaither of Alexandria, Indiana. George was the father of Emmy-winning gospel singer Bill Gaither, who is also from Alexandria, Indiana.

The Mayor of Portland, Indiana plans to revitalize downtown Portland, Indiana. He hopes to build a new learning center, a park to commemorate veterans, and a resource center for construction in Jay County, Indiana.
Weather.
A program in the Anderson Community Schools allows students to arrive early at their schools to participate in voluntary morning exercise programs.

originalRecord.title: Newslink Indiana video 2004-11-19
originalRecord.coverage: Muncie; Delaware County; Indiana; United States; North and Central America;
description: Senior advocates in Union City, Indiana have announced plans to create affordable apartments for senior citizens. The group will re-purpose the abandoned West Side High School building in Union City, Indiana, to create Hoosier Place, an apartment building for people 55 and older.

The Center for Character Development at Anderson University will co-sponsor a No Bullying initiative on November 19, 2004. The event will feature Rodger Dinwiddie, an educator and activist. The goal of the event is to bring bullying to the forefront of community consciousness.
Weather.

description: Vandals caused approximately $10,000 in damages to the Miami Indian Cemetery in Grant County, the largest Indian cemetery in Indiana.
Three people were injured after two trucks collided at the intersection of Walnut Street and SR 28, one of the most dangerous intersections in Muncie, Indiana.
Weather.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2004-11-22
description: A federal court has passed a motion preventing the family of a Ball State University student from suing BSU. The BSU student was shot and killed by a Ball State University Police officer on November 8, 2003. Michael McKinney, 21, was mistaken for a burglar by rookie BSUP officer Robert Duplain, who shot McKinney 4 times.

Grant County, Indiana is mourning the death of United States Marine Corps Corporal Lance M. Thompson, 21. Thompson was killed during an enemy action in the city of Ar Ramadi, Al Anbar Province, Iraq on November 15, 2004, while serving in the Iraq War.
Weather.

description: The Burris Laboratory School in Muncie, Indiana will hold mock elections, mirroring the 2004 Indiana gubernatorial election and the 2004 United States presidential election. K-12 students will also get the chance to hold mock debates for their candidates of choice.

The Animal Control Board of Delaware County, Indiana announced plans to move both its homeless animal population and its animal control operations. Delaware County was utilizing the Randolph County Animal Shelter in Winchester, Indiana, but will now switch to the Henry County Humane Society in New Castle, Indiana.

Weather.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2005-01-21
description: A local man died in a traffic accident on I-69. Mark Rinklespaugh was 21 years-old.
Twenty inmates from the Pendleton Correctional Facility volunteered to assist the Muncie Sanitary District with tree limb cleanup from the recent ice storm in Muncie, Indiana.
The Board of Commissioners of Delaware County, Indiana hopes to receive federal funds to subsidize cleanup efforts after the recent ice storm.
Republican Mitch Daniels, Governor of Indiana, visited Anderson, Indiana to assess damage caused by the recent ice storm.

The Muncie Regional Commerce Office, a local branch of the Indiana Department of Commerce, will close. Republican Mitch Daniels, Governor of Indiana, is closing seven of the twelve regional offices. Governor Daniels ultimately plans on closing the Indiana Department of Commerce entirely and replacing it with the Indiana Economic Development Corporation, a public-private hybrid.
Weather.

Richmond Parks and Recreation has requested nearly $70,000 in back rent from the Richmond Roosters. The Roosters are a Frontier League professional baseball team who have been using the city-owned Don McBride Stadium in Richmond, Indiana since 1995.
Two high school boys' basketball teams from Muncie, Indiana will play a highly-anticipated game on January 21, 2005 - Muncie Central High School and Muncie Southside High School.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2005-01-18
description: Republican Mitch Daniels, Governor of Indiana, revealed plans for tax increases and changes in education funding in his first State of the State address.

An Anderson, Indiana man was arrested after he illegally entered the Advanced Magnesium Alloys Corporation plant in Anderson, Indiana. The man was attempting to put out a massive fire in the plant with a hand-held fire extinguisher
The Town of Yorktown, Indiana is still under a boil-water advisory after a 12-inch water main broke on January 16, 2005.

The New Castle-Henry County Public Library in New Castle, Indiana is being renovated and expanded. Work on the NCHCPL building began in August 2003, and is scheduled for completion on February 14, 2005. The expansion will add an extra 40,000 square feet to the Library building.

Autocar LLC, a service truck manufacturing company based in Hagerstown, Indiana, has introduced a new product. The Easy On Bus is a mid-sized passenger bus with an automatic ramp built into its doorway, which folds out to allow easy access for handicapped passengers. The Easy on Bus' ramp is faster and more cost effective to operate than a traditional lift.
Weather.
A junior champion swimmer succeeds despite not having a pool at her home or school. Sarah Kowalski is a sophomore at Cowan High School.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2005-02-08
description: Local residents lined up at the Federal Emergency Management Association's State Disaster Recovery Center in hopes of receiving financial assistance after the January 2005 ice storm.

The government of Delaware County, Indiana will receive financial assistance from the Federal Emergency Management Association to aid clean-up efforts after the January 2005 ice storm. FEMA will reimburse Delaware County, Indiana for 75% of the total amount spent on clean-up efforts, including equipment rental, contractors, work crews, etc.
A construction crew in Lapel, Indiana accidentally damaged a fiber-optic line on February 8, 2005.
A local commissioner in the Department of Weights and Measurements supports an ordinance that would allow the DWM to issue stiffer penalties to establishments whose scales do not weigh correctly.
A new food court will open in downtown Muncie, Indiana. Walnut Crossing will seat about 100 people.

The County Clerk of the Circuit Court in Delaware County, Indiana will hold a voting fair on February 10, 2005 at the Horizon Convention Center in Muncie, Indiana. Attendees will be able to try and comment upon different voting machines being showcased by several voting machine manufacturers.
Weather.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2005-02-09
description: Lynn Mucha, Director for Psychological Services at the Youth Opportunity Center in Muncie, Indiana, was arrested for driving while intoxicated. The arrest was Mucha's third arrest on criminal charges since 1992.

Cowan Elementary School and Mitchell Elementary School are using wireless technology to communicate with each other in new ways - allowing teachers to stream lesson plans, students to go on electronic field trips, etc.
Renovation efforts on the High Street Bridge in Muncie, Indiana are continuing despite the cold and rainy weather.
Hills Floral Group, the largest floral distributor in the United States, is preparing for Valentine's Day 2005. HFG estimates that they will send out over 4 million flowers this week alone.

Muncie Mission Ministries held its Walk a Mile fundraiser. Participants traveled by foot through neighborhoods inhabited by the indigent, in hopes of raising awareness about how the homeless and needy live.
Weather.

Phyllis Baskerville explains how her Dolly Mama Toy Museum came into existence. Baskerville has collected thousands of dolls since her 65th birthday, which now fill a former Pentecostal church in Fortville, Indiana.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2005-02-10
description: A vehicle belonging to Tom Saunders, Indiana State Representative for District 54, may have been involved in a hit-and-run traffic accident that killed Thomas Jackman of New Castle, Indiana on February 4, 2005. The New Castle Police Department has impounded the car.

Muncie Community Schools plans to eliminate faculty, staff, and administration positions. MCS is also considering increasing class sizes. Both initiatives would address planned cuts in state funding for public K-12 education, which MCS estimates would cost them $2.3 million dollars over the next two years.

The County Clerk of the Circuit Court in Delaware County, Indiana held a voting fair on February 10, 2005 at the Horizon Convention Center in Muncie, Indiana. Attendees were able to try and comment upon different voting machines being showcased by several voting machine manufacturers.

New traffic lights were installed at the intersection of McGalliard Road and Tillotson Avenue in Muncie, Indiana. A brief traffic jam resulted when motorists were denied access to several lanes on both streets.
A vehicle slid off of White River Boulevard in Muncie, Indiana due to slick, snowy driving conditions.

originalRecord.title: Newslink Indiana video 2005-02-10
originalRecord.coverage: Muncie; Delaware County; Indiana; United States; North and Central America;
description: A vehicle belonging to Tom Saunders, Indiana State Representative for District 54, may have been involved in a hit-and-run traffic accident that killed Thomas Jackman of New Castle, Indiana on February 4, 2005. The New Castle Police Department has impounded the car.

Muncie Community Schools plans to eliminate faculty, staff, and administration positions. MCS is also considering increasing class sizes. Both initiatives would address planned cuts in state funding for public K-12 education, which MCS estimates would cost them $2.3 million dollars over the next two years.

The County Clerk of the Circuit Court in Delaware County, Indiana held a voting fair on February 10, 2005 at the Horizon Convention Center in Muncie, Indiana. Attendees were able to try and comment upon different voting machines being showcased by several voting machine manufacturers.

New traffic lights were installed at the intersection of McGalliard Road and Tillotson Avenue in Muncie, Indiana. A brief traffic jam resulted when motorists were denied access to several lanes on both streets.
A vehicle slid off of White River Boulevard in Muncie, Indiana due to slick, snowy driving conditions.

description: A severe storm left several local homes without power on the morning of February 13, 2006. Some residents also reported minor wind damage.
Republican Mike Pence, the U.S. Representative for Indiana's 6th district, gave a speech in Muncie, Indiana on February 13, 2006.
Government officials in Randolph County, Indiana are seeking funding to repair their County's deteriorating sewer systems.
Organizers of the Muncie Gras fundraiser in Muncie, Indiana announced that the proceeds from this year's event will be used to help fund the 24th annual St. Patrick's Day Parade in Muncie, Indiana.
Weather.
The Muncie Central High School boys' basketball team will be playing Warsaw Community High School in the Indiana High School Athletic Association's 2006 4A Regional Championships.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2006-02-15
description: A four month-long investigation into local distributors of MDMA landed a local resident in the Wayne County Jail.

Over 1000 new jobs have been created or will soon be created in Muncie, Indiana. A planned new office for the SLM Corporation accounts for the majority of the new jobs. Recent store and factory openings in the area have created hundreds of jobs as well.

A bill in the Indiana General Assembly would put an end to wine-tastings at small wineries in Indiana. Many owners of small wineries object to the bill, claiming that purchases related to wine tastings account for much of their business.
A new housing addition being built in Lapel, Indiana could more than double the population of the small town.
The Delaware County Election Board has adopted a new electronic voting system.
Weather.

Members of the Delaware County Sheriff's Department will be serving at the Texas Roadhouse restaurant in Muncie, Indiana on February 15, 2006. The Tip A Cop fundraiser will benefit the Indiana Special Olympics.

description: A four month-long investigation into local distributors of MDMA landed a local resident in the Wayne County Jail.

Over 1000 new jobs have been created or will soon be created in Muncie, Indiana. A planned new office for the SLM Corporation accounts for the majority of the new jobs. Recent store and factory openings in the area have created hundreds of jobs as well.

A bill in the Indiana General Assembly would put an end to wine-tastings at small wineries in Indiana. Many owners of small wineries object to the bill, claiming that purchases related to wine tastings account for much of their business.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2005-02-04
description: A man was charged with Contempt of court after making rude remarks to the judge and his lawyer during a child visitation hearing in Muncie, Indiana. Jason Smith briefly escaped from court into downtown Muncie, Indiana, before ultimately being apprehended by the Muncie Police Department.

Two members of the Indiana House of Representatives, Democrat F. Dale Grubb and Republican Gerald Torr, debate whether all Indiana counties should be in the Central Time Zone. They also discussed whether Indiana should begin using Daylight savings time.

Thousands of residents of Muncie, Indiana briefly lost power on February 4, 2005. Indiana Michigan Power has identified the cause as a failed capacitor in Muncie, Indiana, which they have since repaired.

The American Dental Association's third annual Give Kids a Smile day was on February 4, 2005. 180 Indiana dentists provided free oral health care services to children from low-income families across the State of Indiana.

Two Muncie, Indiana men were arrested in Cambridge City, Indiana for attempted robbery. The two men were apprehended when their truck became stuck in the snow behind a CVS Pharmacy and a Dollar General store they had allegedly stolen money from.
The Delaware County Health Department has announced that the local influenza vaccine shortage is over. Anyone can receive a flu shot now at the Muncie Mall in Muncie, Indiana, for just $10 a shot.
Weather.
The Daleville High School girls' basketball team broke their 113-game losing streak in impressive fashion, with a 67-21 win.

description: The 1954-1955 Crispus Attucks High School boys' basketball team (31-1) was collectively inducted into The Indiana Basketball Hall of Fame. The Flying Tigers' 1955 state basketball championship marked the first time an African American school won an open state tournament anywhere in the nation. CAHS also won the state title in 1955-1956 (31-0), with senior Oscar Robertson being named Indiana Mr. Basketball for 1956.

description: A young woman found walking on a county road near Marion, Indiana has been identified as an escapee from a mental health facility in Michigan.
A fire in Anderson, Indiana destroyed a row of stores owned by a religious organization that attempts to help ex-convicts.
The government of Blackford County, Indiana is attempting to improve the aesthetic appearance of the County, in hopes of attracting new businesses.

Cannon Industries, the industrial division of Hillcroft Services Inc., employs hundreds of adults with disabilities to provide subcontract work for businesses in Indiana. CI has locations in Franklin, Muncie and New Castle, Indiana.
Weather.

A former resident of New Orleans, Louisiana has opened her own restaurant in Eaton, Indiana. The restaurant will feature authentic New Orleans cuisine and other made-from-scratch foods. The restaurateur was forced to relocate after Hurricane Katrina.
The New Castle-Henry County Public Library in New Castle, Indiana offers an ongoing calendar of events specifically designed for teenagers.

description: The Final Report of the National Commission on Terrorist Attacks Upon the United States (a.k.a. The 9/11 Commission Report) will be officially issued on July 22, 2004. The Report will be available on the internet for free, and will also be available in book form for purchase.
The Department of Homeland Security's budget for Delaware County, Indiana has doubled, rising to $600,000 for 2004.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2005-09-29
description: Four prisoners escaped from the Henry County Jail in New Castle, Indiana on September 28, 2005. Two prisoners were re-captured after a few hours, and two other prisoners remain at large.

A new McDonald's restaurant has opened on East McGalliard Road in Muncie, Indiana. The location celebrated its grand opening by giving away tickets redeemable for free Big Macs for a year to its first 100 customers.
A major railroad crossing in Muncie, Indiana reopened on September 29, 2005. The railroad crossing, which crosses McGalliard Road near Broadway Avenue, had been closed since September 19, 2005.

Greater Muncie, Indiana Habitat for Humanity began work on its sixth house this year on September 29, 2005 in Muncie, Indiana. That house will be built entirely by women, as part of GMIHFH's Women Build 2005 program.
Weather.
Paws Away Rescue in Eaton, Indiana has found temporary homes for 60 animals displaced by Hurricane Katrina. Local volunteers are caring for most of the animals.

description: Four prisoners escaped from the Henry County Jail in New Castle, Indiana on September 28, 2005. Two prisoners were re-captured after a few hours, and two other prisoners remain at large.

A new McDonald's restaurant has opened on East McGalliard Road in Muncie, Indiana. The location celebrated its grand opening by giving away tickets redeemable for free Big Macs for a year to its first 100 customers.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2005-02-18
description: Andrew Saunders, the son of Indiana State Representative for District 54 Tom Saunders, has turned himself into the New Castle Police Department. The NCPD had issued an arrest warrant for Andrew, who may have been involved in a hit-and-run traffic accident that killed Thomas Jackman of New Castle, Indiana on February 4, 2005.

The City of Anderson, Indiana has requested assistance from the Indiana Department of Environmental Management with clean-up efforts after a fire at the Advanced Magnesium Alloys Corporation plant in Anderson, Indiana in January 2005. They fear that residents in nearby neighborhoods could be exposed to asbestos or other harmful substances during the AMACOR clean-up process.
Wayne C. Melton has been released from the Jay County Jail after his family posted bail. Melton allegedly attempted to abduct a convenience store employee in Redkey, Indiana.

Richmond Parks and Recreation has requested over four years worth of back rent from the Richmond Roosters, a Frontier League professional baseball team. The Roosters have played their home games at the city-owned Don McBride Stadium in Richmond, Indiana since 1995.
The Indiana General Assembly is considering a proposal that would allow some Indiana preschoolers to begin attending kindergarten at a younger age.
Weather.
The First Baptist Church in New Castle, Indiana has purchased and renovated a former Wal-Mart store in New Castle, Indiana, which will serve as their new church building.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2005-02-16
description: The New Castle Police Department has issued an arrest warrant for Andrew Saunders, the son of Indiana State Representative for District 54 Tom Saunders. The NCPD believes that Andrew may have been involved in a hit-and-run traffic accident that killed Thomas Jackman of New Castle, Indiana on February 4, 2005.
The Street Department of the City of Muncie, Indiana explains how drivers can fill out claims with the City if their vehicles are damaged by potholes within city limits.

Police in Redkey, Indiana have arrested a man who allegedly attempted to abduct a convenience store employee in Redkey, Indiana. The alleged abductor, Wayne C. Melton, later checked into Ball Memorial Hospital in Muncie, Indiana for treatment of unspecified mental health problems.
Family Forever Ministries Inc. of Anderson, Indiana hopes to purchase and renovate Killbuck Park in Anderson, Indiana. FFMI is currently in the fundraising stage.

Schools under the jurisdiction of The Delaware Community School Corporation, Cowan Community Schools and the Jay School Corporation all performed well on the Indiana Statewide Testing for Educational Progress standardized tests, exceeding the average scores.
Weather.
Cell phone advertising might be the wave of the future, according to a study by the Ball State University Department of Journalism.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2005-02-02
description: Committees in the Indiana House of Representatives and Indiana Senate both approved bills that would protect groundhogs. The new bills would give the State of Indiana control over the hunting of groundhogs, both for sport and as a means of population control.
Officials in Delaware County would like a new emergency radio dispatch system. They argue that their current system is technologically obsolete and overloaded.

The Grace Missionary Baptist Church in Marion, Indiana continues its attempts to fire their pastor, Rev. Ed McDowell Jr. A vote by trustees and members of GMBC in December 2004 stripped McDowell of his official title, but McDowell insists the vote was invalid.
The Pennsylvania Railroad Station in Richmond, Indiana has been added to the 10 Most Endangered 2005 list released by the Historic Landmarks Foundation of Indiana.

Republican Mike Pence, the U.S. Representative for Indiana's 6th congressional district, introduced two new pieces of legislation - The Small Business Healthcare Savings Act (H.R. 490) and The Free Flow of Information Act (H.R. 985).

The Eaton Public Library in Eaton, Indiana has received a gift from a local resident that will allow local children to use the Library free of charge. The EPL, which does not receive any state or federal funding, will continue to charge adult patrons a membership fee.

description: The suspect in the fatal shooting of Muncie, Indiana resident Dick Moore on December 5, 2004 has been officially charged with murder. The suspect is currently in the hospital for a surgical procedure, but will be sent to jail after his release.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2005-01-12
description: Local residents reflect on last week's ice storm and their communities' responses to it.
There has been some flooding in Muncie, Indiana, caused by a combination of melting ice from last week's ice storm and the rain on January 11, 2005.

There has been flooding in several places in east-central Indiana, caused by melting ice from last week's ice storm and the rain on January 11, 2005. Areas near waterways are at especially high risk, as are roads and bridges.
Weather.

There has been some flooding in Portland, Indiana, caused by a combination of melting ice from last week's ice storm and the rain on January 11, 2005. Downtown streets and residential areas were effected, and some roadways and businesses had to close.

description: Local residents reflect on last week's ice storm and their communities' responses to it.
There has been some flooding in Muncie, Indiana, caused by a combination of melting ice from last week's ice storm and the rain on January 11, 2005.

There has been flooding in several places in east-central Indiana, caused by melting ice from last week's ice storm and the rain on January 11, 2005. Areas near waterways are at especially high risk, as are roads and bridges.
Weather.

There has been some flooding in Portland, Indiana, caused by a combination of melting ice from last week's ice storm and the rain on January 11, 2005. Downtown streets and residential areas were effected, and some roadways and businesses had to close.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2005-01-26
description: A gas leak in New Castle, Indiana forced the evacuation of a three-block area while crews worked to fix a ruptured gas line.
Wal-Mart Stores, Inc. has announced that it will build a new perishable food distribution center in Gas City, Indiana. The center would bring 600 new jobs to the Gas City, Indiana area.

Jo Ann M. Gora, President of Ball State University, announced a new set of scholarships available to incoming freshmen at BSU. The scholarships will be paid for in part by funds that would have been spent on Gora's inaugural ceremony.
The Indiana Senate and the Indiana House of Representatives brought in hundreds of Girl Scouts to help them with their duties. The Indiana General Assembly is celebrating females in government.
The Hartford City Public Library's Friends of the Library holds monthly book sales to raise money for the HCPL and community programs in Hartford City, Indiana.
The Mayor of Montpelier, Indiana plans to create a new industrial park, financed partly by a large monetary grant.
Weather.
The Papa John's Pizza location in Muncie, Indiana prepared 200 pizzas for audience members attending a speech given by Papa John's founder John Schnatter at Ball State University.

originalRecord.title: Newslink Indiana video 2004-09-27
originalRecord.coverage: Muncie; Delaware County; Indiana; United States; North and Central America;
description: Anti-tobacco activist Rick Stoddard spoke to students of Marion Community Schools about the dangers of smoking. Stoddard's wife died of lung cancer in 2000, at the age of 46.

Bonzi Wells, a shooting guard for the NBA's Memphis Grizzlies, returned to his hometown for the dedication of the Bonzi Wells Gymnasium in the Roy C. Buley Community Center. Wells was born in Muncie, Indiana, and played at Muncie Central High School and Ball State University. He began playing basketball at the Buley Center as a child.
Weather.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2004-10-19
description: The Park Board of the City of Muncie, Indiana will vote on several new regulations for campers at the Prairie Creek Reservoir and Campground in Muncie, Indiana on October 19, 2004. The proposed regulations would require campers to register for camping spaces, prevent them from staying for an indefinite period of time, and set limits on the sizes of their decks and canopies.
The Muncie Police Department has not yet identified a suspect in the robbery of the Old National Bank on South Madison Street in Muncie, Indiana on the morning of October 13, 2004.
Weather.

description: The possible construction of new homes in Hamilton Township, Delaware County, Indiana could create a major problem for the Township's sewer system. The current system, which cost over $15 million dollars, has been plagued with cost overruns and construction problems.

The Colts Community, the community relations arm of the Indianapolis Colts football team, visited the Roy C. Buley Community Center in Muncie, Indiana as part of its Vectren Volunteer Outreach Program. Colts rookies Ben Hartsock and Ben Utecht, both tight ends, helped paint and clean the Buley Center. The Buley Center offers a variety of services to youth, adults, and senior citizens.
Weather.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2004-11-16
description: The Madison County Prosecutor may be forced to stop pursuing the death penalty against an alleged murderer. The accused has invoked his right of free legal counsel, and Madison County, Indiana does not have the funds required to pay attorneys for both sides of a capital murder trial.

Ball State University averaged less than 15,000 people in attendance at their home football games for the 2004 season. Similar attendance numbers in the 2005 season might cause them to forfeit their status in the National Collegiate Athletic Association's Division I Football Bowl Subdivision. NCAA legislation requires a minimum average of 15,000 people in attendance at home football games every other year for a school to remain in Division I.
Weather.

description: Shareholders voted to approve the sale of Maxon Corporation, a manufacturer of industrial combustion equipment and shut-off valves, to HKW Capital Partners II, an Indianapolis-based private equity firm.
Dougherty Orchard, an apple orchard in Cambridge City, Indiana, is experiencing a better-than-normal crop in 2004.
Weather.

description: A local man was found guilty in the shooting death of a teenager from Yorktown, Indiana in 2000.
A jury in Blackford County, Indiana is deliberating in the case of a man accused of fatally stabbing a Montpelier, Indiana man.

Cannon Industries, the industrial division of Hillcroft Services Inc., employs hundreds of adults with disabilities to provide subcontract work for businesses in Indiana. CI has locations in Franklin, Muncie and New Castle, Indiana.
High energy costs and fertilizer costs are negatively effecting local farmers.

Eighth graders at Delta Middle School in Muncie, Indiana are participating in a fundraiser for the Animal Rescue Fund of Muncie, Indiana. The students are creating artwork, selling that artwork, and then donating the proceeds to ARF.
Weather.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2006-03-08
description: The United States Congress is reducing spending for many programs designed to aid the poor. Funding has been cut for affordable housing, housing development, and community development. There will also be a reduction in additional school services for underprivileged students.

The owners of a condemned building in downtown Marion, Indiana are suing the City of Marion, Indiana. They have been ordered by the City of Marion, Indiana to renovate their building, lest it be torn down.
Emergency management officials are at odds with some residents of a local housing community over the placement of a proposed emergency siren.

A Muncie Indiana Transit System bus driver assisted a local child who may have been abused. The driver provided the child with a telephone and a safe place to meet with the Muncie Police Department. The child alleges that their mother was abusing them.
A company in Richmond, Indiana is relocating to Ohio.
The Indiana Finance Authority recently approved a new program that will make it easier for new businesses to move into and build on properties.
Weather.

description: The Delaware County Board of Health voted unanimously in favor of a proposal that would ban smoking in public places in Delaware County, Indiana. The proposal will now be voted on by the Board of Commissioners of Delaware County, Indiana.
A woman in Muncie, Indiana will face murder charges after shooting her ex-boyfriend during an argument.
A resident of New Castle, Indiana will appear on Home & Garden Television. The local business owner renovated a building in downtown New Castle, Indiana, which he is now using as his home.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2006-03-15
description: Ball State University's head men's basketball coach has been reassigned, following the Cardinals' disappointing 10-18 record in the 2005-2006 season. Tim Buckley will be moved to BSU's University Development office, which raises funds to support the educational mission of BSU. Buckley was an assistant coach at BSU under Ray McCallum from 1994-1999, then head coach from 2000-2006.

The Major Moves initiative has now been approved by both the Indiana House of Representatives and the Indiana Senate. Major Moves call for the State of Indiana to lease the Indiana East-West Toll Road to private companies. The funds generated by the leasing would be applied toward a 10-year, $12 billion plan to significantly improve and expand Indianaâs highway infrastructure.
Republican Mitch Daniels, Governor of Indiana, invited reporters to the Indiana Statehouse on March 15, 2006 to discuss the recently concluded short session of the Indiana General Assembly.
Bus drivers in Anderson, Indiana are being negatively effected by rising fuel prices.

Entertainer Ed McMahon joined Dan Canan, Mayor of Muncie, Indiana at the ribbon-cutting for the Royal Crown Hold'Em Club in Muncie, Indiana. The poker club is located in a renovated building in downtown Muncie, Indiana.

originalRecord.title: Newslink Indiana video 2006-03-15
originalRecord.coverage: Muncie; Delaware County; Indiana; United States; North and Central America;
description: Ball State University's head men's basketball coach has been reassigned, following the Cardinals' disappointing 10-18 record in the 2005-2006 season. Tim Buckley will be moved to BSU's University Development office, which raises funds to support the educational mission of BSU. Buckley was an assistant coach at BSU under Ray McCallum from 1994-1999, then head coach from 2000-2006.

The Major Moves initiative has now been approved by both the Indiana House of Representatives and the Indiana Senate. Major Moves call for the State of Indiana to lease the Indiana East-West Toll Road to private companies. The funds generated by the leasing would be applied toward a 10-year, $12 billion plan to significantly improve and expand Indianaâs highway infrastructure.
Republican Mitch Daniels, Governor of Indiana, invited reporters to the Indiana Statehouse on March 15, 2006 to discuss the recently concluded short session of the Indiana General Assembly.
Bus drivers in Anderson, Indiana are being negatively effected by rising fuel prices.

Entertainer Ed McMahon joined Dan Canan, Mayor of Muncie, Indiana at the ribbon-cutting for the Royal Crown Hold'Em Club in Muncie, Indiana. The poker club is located in a renovated building in downtown Muncie, Indiana.
Weather.
The True Bay Group played traditional Irish folk music at the Muncie Public Library's Carnegie Library branch in downtown Muncie, Indiana.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2005-03-11
description: A judge in Madison County, Indiana has ruled that Frederick Baer may not plead guilty but mentally ill in his murder trial. Baer now plans to plead not guilty, in hopes of avoiding the death penalty.
The Common Council of Anderson, Indiana has formed a committee to address perennial budget shortages in the Anderson Fire Department.

An Anderson, Indiana woman is in the Madison County Jail after allegedly attempting to obtain prescription drugs via illegal means. She has been charged with fraud, identity theft, drug forgery and eight other offenses.
Gasoline prices jumped fifteen cents in the past week, as the price of crude oil reached nearly $54 a barrel.

The Richmond Municipal Airport in Richmond, Indiana is being considered as a test site for a new system of air travel. The Small Aircraft Transportation System (SATS) is conceived as a safe travel alternative, freeing people and products from existing transportation system delays, by creating access to more communities in less time.

Life Force Studios of Marion, Indiana has officially opened. The combination tattoo shop, local art gallery and full service photography studio had been involved in a six-week zoning battle with the City of Marion, Indiana.
Weather.

Indiana ranks 35th out of the 50 states in public arts funding. Some local organizations are trying to find ways to increase public arts funding.

First graders who attended full-day kindergarten have better scores in multiple subjects than first graders who attended half-day kindergarten, according to statistics released by Marion Community Schools in January 2006.

Northside Elementary School in Hartford City, Indiana won the Governor's Fitness Award for the second year in a row. INShape Indiana and the Indiana Governor's Council for Physical Fitness and Sports jointly sponsor the GFAs, which honor schools that show a commitment to health and exercise.

NewsLink staff can be found covering Grant, Blackford, Jay, Randolph, Wayne, Henry, Madison and Delaware counties.
collection.title: Newslink Indiana Videos

originalRecord.title: Newslink Indiana video 2004-09-18
originalRecord.coverage: Muncie; Delaware County; Indiana; United States; North and Central America;
description: The Howard County Vietnam Veterans Organization is preparing for their 22nd Annual Vietnam Veterans Reunion. They expect over 20,000 veterans from around the country to attend the reunion, which will be held east of Kokomo, Indiana on private property owned by the HCVVO.
David Bennett, a guitarist from Henry County, Indiana, is releasing his first solo album. Bennett performs live every Wednesday night at Doc's Music Hall in Muncie, Indiana.
Weather.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2004-09-03
description: The 2004 Indiana gubernatorial election between Democratic incumbent Joe Kernan and Republican challenger Mitch Daniels is less than two months from its conclusion, on November 2, 2004. One of the main issues the candidates are debating is property taxes.
Rob Schwartz, an assistant professor in Ball State University's Department of Geography, has been researching hurricane damage and disaster relief since the 1970s.
Weather.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2004-08-24
description: Republican Dan Canan, Mayor of Muncie, Indiana, has partially rescinded a ban on flying any flag at the Prairie Creek Reservoir and Campground. Campers will now be allowed to fly American flags or POW/MIA flags. Canan apologized to campers, and explained that Muncie plans on implementing new rules about flags for the Campground in 2005.
The City of Muncie, Indiana has decided to rename a portion of Broadway Avenue to Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. Boulevard. The decision comes after over a year of debate.
Weather.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2006-02-07
description: A trailer in Pennville, Indiana caught on fire. The residents of the trailer, a mother and her children, escaped unharmed from the fire.
The Board of Commissioners of Delaware County, Indiana voted unanimously in favor of a proposal that would ban smoking in public places in Delaware County, Indiana.

A local interior designer is attempting to help renovate downtown Muncie, Indiana. The designer is collaborating with local shops to make downtown Muncie, Indiana more aesthetically-pleasing and more family-friendly.

Authorities in Delaware County, Indiana are investigating a case of attempted sabotage near Shideler, Indiana. Local farmers found sharp objects buried in their fields, likely intended to damage their farm equipment.
Weather.

Six public schools in Delaware County, Indiana have received the Indiana Department of Education's Four Star School Award. Four Star Schools must meet AYP (Adequate Yearly Progress) under the No Child Left Behind Act of 2001, perform in the top 25% on the ISTEP+ standardized tests, and perform in the top 25% on attendance rates.
A music teacher in New Castle, Indiana won the Indiana Outstanding Middle/High School Music Educator of the Year award.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2005-10-31
description: WIPB-TV will broadcast its first digital television signals on October 31, 2005.
Frank Elliott Ball Memorial Hall at Ball State University sponsored a haunted house on October 31, 2005.
The Hall Director for Frank Elliott Ball Memorial Hall at Ball State University tells the story of a former resident of Elliott Hall who hung himself in Elliott Hall.
The Anderson Costume Store in Chesterfield, Indiana offers many different types and styles of costumes.
Weather.

An attorney from Muncie, Indiana has received the Indiana Pro Bono Commission's Randall T. Shepard Award. Richard Hughes was recognized by the IPBC for the free legal services he has developed and offered to Indiana citizens.
Home sales in Muncie, Indiana are rising again.
The Internal Revenue Service reports that thousands of dollars in refunds have gone unclaimed, in part due to incorrect addresses.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2005-10-28
description: The congregation of North Meridian United Methodist Church in Redkey, Indiana sold their vacant church building on eBay for $40,600. Theirs is believed to be the first church building ever sold in an online auction. NMUMC plans to donate the proceeds to victims of Hurricane Katrina.
Dr. Greg Polan of the Mayo Clinic spoke about avian influenza at Taylor University in Upland, Indiana.
The Communication Alliance to Network Thoroughbred Ex-Racehorses (CANTER) provides retiring thoroughbred racehorses with opportunities for new careers.
Weather.

The Farmland Friends Church of Farmland, Indiana has donated money to an unlikely recipient - a local gas station. FFC's money will be used to partially reimburse customers who purchase gasoline at the station, giving them 25 cents back per dollar spent (up to $10 dollars total).

The Dehority Residence Hall Complex at Ball State University will hold its annual Box City event on October 28, 2005. Over 100 BSU students plan to voluntarily sleep outside in boxes on the BSU Green to raise awareness about homelessness in Muncie, Indiana.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2005-01-27
description: Police issued an AMBER alert for Katlyn "Katie" Coleman, a 10-year-old girl from Crothersville, Indiana, on January 27, 2005.
A 100-year-old house near Selma, Indiana has burned down. Several fire departments collaborated to extinguish the fire.

NewsLink Indiana offers tips on how to fill out state tax forms for the State of Indiana.
Muncie Mission Ministries is selling orange bracelets to raise funds to help the homeless in east-central Indiana.

Weather.

sourceResource.title: Newslink Indiana video 2004-10-20
description: The Park Board of the City of Muncie, Indiana approved several new regulations for campers at the Prairie Creek Reservoir and Campground in Muncie, Indiana on October 19, 2004. Campers will now be required to register for camping spaces, will not be allowed to stay for an indefinite period of time, and must honor limits on the sizes of their decks and canopies.
Police In Ohio have arrested two people suspected of committing telephone fraud against the St. Mark Church of God in Christ in Anderson, Indiana.
Weather.

Some police in east-central Indiana wish that civilians were not able to purchase tasers. Civilians may purchase tasers without completing any training or undergoing background checks.
Repairs on a 55-foot sinkhole in Richmond, Indiana are almost complete.
Weather.
Wuzzy Bear teaches students at Royerton Elementary School about proper nutrition, exercise, and health.

description: The Muncie Indiana Transit System has purchased updated buses with new features. The 11 updated buses will be replacing 11 obsolete buses on November 21, 2005.

Employees of the City of Anderson, Indiana will not have to pay health insurance premiums in December 2005. The City recently switched health carriers, in hopes of saving itself and its employees money.
The Federal Emergency Management Agency will cease paying for hotel and motel rooms for victims of Hurricane Katrina effective November 30, 2005.

The Old Winchester Graveyard Restoration Committee has begun an effort to restore the The Old Winchester Graveyard in Winchester, Indiana. The OWGRC hopes to repair, re-erect and clean over 100 monuments that have been neglected for decades. The OWG restoration is a project of the Randolph County, Indiana Historical Society.
Weather.
